Reviews.Title: “2 weeks in paradise!”
Reviews.Author: Clark B
Reviews.Content: Wow! My wife and I have travelled the world and stayed at plenty of top notch resorts, but the Alii was just perfect! We were lucky enough to have a 2 bedroom ocean deluxe condo right on the beach. Everything could not have been better.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded High Expectations”
Reviews.Author: MJCZLawrence
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 5 wonderful days at the Ali'i. We had heard and read wonderful things about it and I was concerned we would be disappointed. It was everything we heard about and more. We went for an Ocean Front two bedroom and the view and accomodations were spectacular. We were on the third floor which gave us an unabstructed view but was still below the canopy of the palm trees.The staff were extremely friendly and helpful and we never once felt they were only interested in tips. The beach area in front odf the Ali'i was the best on Kaanapali and we were very convenient to Whaler Village and other areas of interest. We definitely will return and give it our highest recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “Treated Like Alii”
Reviews.Author: Tim S
Reviews.Content: 'Alil' is the word that Hawaiians use to describe 'royalty' and during my recent stay at the Kaanapali Alii, I was always treated like royalty! And another Hawaiian word that helps me to describe my stay at the resort is 'Na Ka 'Oi', which translates to mean 'the best'! From the moment I arrived and all throughout my stay, my experiences there were always the best of the best all around me. Every aspect of the resort was impressive. Every staff member I saw displayed the real spirit of aloha. The cleanliness, the amenities, the service and more were all more than enough for me to say that I fully enjoyed my time there and I will be looking forward to my next visit at the Kaanapali Alii. I've been all over Hawaii and I know what to expect....the Kaannapali Alii is my highest recommended resort to anyone visiting Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Stay”
Reviews.Author: maryChico
Reviews.Content: Moved over to Kaanapali Alii after two miserable days at Westin next door. It was a wonderful move, but quite a bit more costly. In exchange though, at Alii a guest doesn't have to pay $20/day for parking or a "resort fee" of $25/day. We stayed in room 114 (not sure what building); bottom story. It great to stay on ground floor; we could just walk straight thru back sliders to pool area and beach. Our condo was one bedroom with murphy bed in living area. We were told we would have two beds, so a little disappointed to find out one was murphy, but it was workable; just felt staff should have been a little more forthcoming with that info. Also, mattress on bedroom bed needs replacement ASAP...it has a serious dip in the middle....so bad we had to put pillows in middle of bed so we wouldn't roll into it. All the condos are different, so be sure to ask a lot of questions. 114 doesn't have a den area, but has large bedroom, beautiful bath, and nicely decorated living area. Also has a small dining area, which we didn't use because we ate on veranda. Full kitchen with granite countertops was such a blessing because I get a little tired of continually eating out, especially in Hawaii where a resort breakfast can run an easy $50/couple! Kitchen was welll appointed with all the necessities. Blender was an inexpensive model, that leaked like crazy when I was making smoothies, but better than nothing. There was all varieties of pots and pans, so finding necessary tools to make a meal was easy. We used common BBQ area one evening, it was clean and well appointed as well. Nice that they have silverware and supplies available so guest doesn't have to haul so much out to utilize feature. Housekeeping freshened up daily and was generous with supplies. Grounds were well maintained and stunning; complete opposite of deferred maintenance at Westin next door. Condo units are very well built....little, if any neighboring or upstairs noise. I agree with other reviewers, that folks who claim a chair by pool early in the day for use several hours later is irritating. There is also an issue with all the kids playing in adult pool. Part of problem seems to be staff doesn't have a person walking the grounds and monitoring pool situation; It doesn't seem like guests should have to be put in the uncomfortable situation of asking another guest to please play by the rules. Its so nice that they offer both pools, both of which are beautiful, just wish other parents and guests abided by rules. I also agree it was great not to have to carry around an ID card to get towlels or use chairs on beach. Workout room is stunning...if you have any inclination at all to get in a workout, its worth it. Busy in the morning, but I was alone in the afternoon. Equipment is new, clean and easy to use. Lots of freeweights and benches are available as well. Beware wireless internet is NOT available in-room. You must go to pool area to receive wireless. There is wired connection in room, but that seems more inconvenient these days than walking to common area. NOTE: Starbucks has shop next door to Alii at neighboring resort...thats a great plus! All in all, if you have to stay at Kaanapali Coast, this is an awesome option. Just be ready for CROWDS and NOISE. Not the Alii's fault, its just the nature of the beast in Kaanapali. Quiet Hawaiin getaways are not what you find there...

Reviews.Title: “Very Good - Now Get Rid of Chair Trolls”
Reviews.Author: DKLC
Reviews.Content: This is almost a perfect hotel, the best we've ever stayed at on Maui. The grounds are immaculate, and the facilities are up-to-date. Itâ€™s location on Kaanapali beach is ideal. I was impressed with the hotel staff, always willing to help, and always smiling and friendly. I also enjoyed the resort's towel policy: Trust. No wrist bands, no towel card. You want a pool towel? Just go pick one up. I'm sure there are some towels that don't get returned, but I imagine the towel return rate is close to 100 percent. It's nice being treated like a responsible adult. Our room (123) was great for our group (three couples). It had enough room that we could invite others over for dinners and gatherings. The suite has recently been refurbished with modern appliances and lighting. This was not an "ocean view" suite, so we also had the construction noise from next door as mentioned in a previous post. However, I can't hold the Alii responsible for that. The noise was a bit bothersome if you stayed in your hotel room all day, but who does that? And we actually enjoyed the Westinâ€™s Luau music. My only complaint is the tiresome invasion of pool-chair trolls. These are the troglodytes that run out early in the morning, place a book and towel on chair/lounger, and expect everyone to respect their territory the entire day. The Alii needs to get aggressive against these lower life forms to prevent chair saving. Just up the beach, another hotel (canâ€™t remember which one) has signs posted around the pool area which remind guests that pool chairs are for â€œactive useâ€� only. This means if a chair is left for more than 25 minutes, the staff removes any personal items that the Chair Hogs have put there. Itâ€™s not that it was impossible to find places to lay out in the shade or sun; itâ€™s just that the nicer spots under umbrellas were always â€œsavedâ€� by these squatters. Fix this one problem, and the Alii is easily a 5 Star property.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we needed!”
Reviews.Author: santacruz2010
Reviews.Content: The Kaanapali Alii was perfect for us. We stayed in Building 3, with a partial ocean view, so from our lanai, we could see the ocean/beach/surfers, the grounds next door and the mountains. The condo unit was very nice and very quiet. Several pools. We used the barbecue area several times to BBQ fresh Ahi. Gorgeous sunsets! An easy walk to the Hula Grill and Lailani's and Black Rock to snorkel, although we snorkeled right outside on our own beach and had a friendly turtle join us. Loved this place.

Reviews.Title: “Another Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: BostonBF
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Kaanapali Alii for the second time this past week. It was another absolutely fantastic stay! This time I stayed with my parents, who had not been here before. They found the accomodations to be top notch,as did I. The furnishings, appliances, etc. are all of very high quality and the views from our ocean-front unit were fantastic. We saw whales each and every day. I'm glad to see that Kaanapali Alii is continuing to keep their facilty up in such great shape - I think the unit we stayed in was better than the last.

Reviews.Title: “Could have been 5 Stars”
Reviews.Author: MIfly
Reviews.Content: We have happily returned to the Kaanapali Ali'i yearly since our first experience in 2008, always renting the same 3 bedroom unit facing the courtyard from building 2, unit 223. Without any doubt we have loved each stay and had no complaints. This year due to the unavailability of our usual favorite we rented a 3 bedroom in building 1 facing the Westin, unit 143. We had views of the Westin and it's waterfall pool which were ok, but still had nice ocean views including Black Rock, from the lanai and bedroom. We really had no complaints, we missed having the courtyard view and sunsets but felt that the cooler afternoons on the shaded lanai were a nice tradeoff. The condo is laid out very similarly to 223 (our "usual") except that the 3rd bedroom/den has a nice wrap around couch and flat screen tv, around 42-48 inch size. Nice touch! It is stocked as well as expected, the safe in the master bedroom worked, and beds were comfortable. We were happy to have the same large lanai as we love to eat all 3 meals out there and spend quite a bit of time socializing around meals. Unfortunately early in the morning on the 3rd day into our stay construction work started up at the Westin just outside of our unit and all day long we had jackhammers and loud construction noise driving us off the lanai. Even with all doors and windows closed the noise was unbearable. My brother in law was along with us on a working vacation and was quite unhappy with losing the quiet working environment he expected. Once the workers quit for the evening and we were looking forward to a nice relaxing dinner on the lanai the Luau from the westin started up, just under the lanai again! While we love the Hawaiian music, drums, and luaus in general, the speakers were so loud and must have been pointed directly at our condo as we couldn't even hold conversation over the music. It was like being at a really loud concert or wedding, and we gave up eating dinner outside. On top of this all, my husband and his sister were both coming off of a very difficult year health-wise and looking forward to a peaceful, healing time in Hawaii. After putting up with this unrelenting noise daily we finally called Maui Beachfront Rentals and complained that we were not happy with the status quo. Having paid the amount of money for an expected quite and restful Hawaiian vacation we were having anything but. I must give Maui Beachfront a shout out as they responded quickly and did what they could to assuage our negative reaction, offering a move to a different condo or a refund of one night and a free night on our next year's rental. I felt that Maui Beachfront Rental didn't have prior knowledge of the construction noise and didn't rent unfairly. The luaus would have been bearable if we hadn't been unable to use the lanai all day also. So as it stands, the condo itself is in good repair, located on the shady and cooler side of the building, clean and comfortable. I was told that the construction will be ongoing through April so if you are planning to rent, beware or check up on this. I can't really complain about the Luau music as it was just an annoyance caused mainly by following up on the heels of the loud jackhammers, etc. We hope to be able to return to our favorite on the courtyard side next year. My husband and I spent 2 weeks at the Whaler in the fall of 2010 and while it was nice, there is no comparison.

Reviews.Title: “A true Hawaiian experience”
Reviews.Author: magicmaker51
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a true Hawaiian adventure. The entire staff is devoted to making your stay memorable. From the moment we arrived, with a special request for a different room (which was taken care of in moments) until the farewell session where we received our leis, every one we came in contact with was helpful, friendly, and eager to please us with a wonderful visit. The rooms are comfortable, clean, and have great views of either the ocean or the grounds. I recommend getting an ocean view room. The food offered by the hotel is uniformly tops. I recommend getting the breakfast with the room. Every morning was a tasty buffet with fish prepared differently each day. All food was good, tasty, and all you can eat. The staff gave interesting and helpful suggestions about sightseeing, trips, directions to various sites, and help make reservations as needed. When I went to give some consideration to the concierge, he refused it and said it was his job and pleasure. One outstanding feature was the beach with complimentary items for our beach use, and the best chocolate smoothies I have ever tasted. Was it the Pacific Ocean air, or did the staff just make the best smoothies? If a hotel was ever committed to making your stay on the island of Maui a total pleasure, this is it.

Reviews.Title: “Totally remodeled unit K211, ground floor,Heaven”
Reviews.Author: bobr4129
Reviews.Content: Since our last visit 2010, we stayed in the same unit, the owner has totally remodeled his unit. We love the ground floor access, easy in and out. Every aspect of the unit is new, more confortable and inviting. We think of the Alii as our second home, we do not want to stay anywhere else, The staff emphasizes the spirit of Aloha. The facilities are totally remodeled throughout new spa, pools,and workout facilities If you like individual service from caring staff without all the big hotel hype, this property is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a family trip”
Reviews.Author: Mike025
Reviews.Content: We booked a two-week stay at the Alii and loved it. There was six of us in a two bedroom plus den with the premier finishes. Some of the appliances did not work, but for the most part everything was in great shape and we had everything we needed for cooking and plenty of hanging out. Our south-facing suite on the 11th floor had views of the mountains and the ocean from the shady lanai. The gym and pool and beach are all great, and the whole place was always quiet and clean. We'll be back I'm sure.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Place”
Reviews.Author: PegPDX
Reviews.Content: I give the Alii 5 stars for being in a great location and having large updated condos with excellent service from the staff. Like everything on Maui, it seemed expensive, even as nice and large as it was. Out "garden view" turned out to be a view of the parking structure but we were offered other rooms and opted not to move. There were a few inconveniences such as the ice maker and the washer were broken! There were some unclean throw rugs in the bathrooms. All of this was remedied quickly by the very attentive and pleasant staff. The grounds and beach are lovely and our room very quiet and comfy. The tennis courts were never crowded and the beach was divine. We loved the outdoor barbecues all set up to use with supplies handy right there. We booked our room through Kay Riley at kay@mauikay.com who was great and helped us get deals on a car and the room. She was super! She was recommended to us by Jon at www.maui.org - a very helpful website!

Reviews.Title: “Great place once we switched rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Anton D
Reviews.Content: Before I get to the some small bad points I will say that the property is gorgeous, the staff is great and the location is perfect! My wife and I stayed there in November of 2011 and we had a standard ocean view 1 bedroom condo. The condos there are huge and 4 people can easily stay in a one bedroom since most of them turn the den into a second bedroom. The standard room was really outdated and very musty and moldy. I have asthma that doesn't really bother me, but I woke up the first night and my chest was tight due to all of the moldy furniture. In the morning I went to the front desk and they switched us to another ocean view room at no charge. This room was one of their premiere rooms and it was amazing!!! It was very recently remodeled and everything inside was fabulous! So if you have a few extra bucks, I would highly recommend premiere rooms over the standards. We had a fabulous time being right on the beautiful Kaanapali Beach! With Black Rock a short walk down the beach, we snorkeled just about everyday. Our room was on the Westin side which has a Luau every other night, so there were times when it was a little on the loud side. All in all it was a great trip and I would definitely stay there again. My only other complaint is there is no bar at the pool. It's not that big of a deal but it would be nice.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fabulous from start to finish”
Reviews.Author: Shazzamelbourne
Reviews.Content: Booked this condo online after internet search and did not regret if. WEnt for a 2 BR ocean front condo which was everything plus more......spacious, comfy beds and fine linen....everything you would need. Pool area fine and on the BEST bit of Kaanaplai Beach there is. Staff could not have been more helpful. Golf is right behind and the gym is great. Great location, close to Whalers Village with lots of restaurants and a convenience store too.

Reviews.Title: “This is what a "Hawaiian Vacation" is all about!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kathy H
Reviews.Content: We took our family to Maui and stayed at the Kaanapali Alli. What an amazing home away from home. The staff were so helpful. The rooms were so warm and inviting. We made some great memories in a wonderful vacation site.

Reviews.Title: “Great property”
Reviews.Author: patspaws
Reviews.Content: I've always said that I'm not much of a beach person or one for sitting by the pool and relaxing, but the Ka'anapali Alli changed that. We rented our condo through VRBO, and had a wonderful week-long stay. The Ka'anapali beachfront is picture perfect and the staff at the Alii go out of their way to make you feel welcome and relaxed. The pools don't have the theme park feel of some other hotels, but I liked that aspect. Families with really small children will appreciate the 1 ft. kiddie pools, older kids will have fun in the main pool, and there's a "quiet pool" section for those who don't want to find themselves in the middle of water games. The property also offers two hot tubs and ample lounge chairs in both sunny and shady locations. The indoor exercise facilities looked nice (but I don't understand why anyone would be running on a treadmill when you have a beautiful beach and paved walkway right outside). The Alii also offers early morning yoga three days a week on the lawn overlooking the ocean. If you're lucky, as I was, you'll be able to see humpbacks diving right off shore as you do your own downward dog. There were other fitness classes, too, but I can't comment on those. Keep in mind that the Alli doesn't offer full hotel services, it's really a condominium resort. So, while they do offer poolside food, it's quite limited with only pre-made sandwiches and cookies that are brought in. On the other hand, the property has several gas grills set up for guests to use. So, if you're happy throwing your own shrimp on the barbie as opposed to ordering room service, it's hard to beat the location and comfort of the Alii.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: klatifi
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I and our wives stayed at Kaanapali Alii over Thanksgiving for 8 days. Saying we loved it is an understatement. The place is perfect. We had a two bedroom condo in building 1 on the 7th floor overlooking the garden and the beach. It was breathtaking. The staff at Kaanapali Alii is very friendly and always helped us with what we needed. The rooms were always clean, with the best part being the balcony and the view. While there, we rented a car and managed to see every part of the island. I would not recommend the drive from Paia to Lahaina using 340. It is beautiful but quite scary. A large portion of the road is single lane (even though it's two way traffic) and no protective barrier... Other than that, enjoy the island, make sure you drive the road to Hana, and go to Mama's Fish House in Paia.

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay with a family on Kanapali!”
Reviews.Author: Kara D
Reviews.Content: We planned a trip to Maui to get married and also the 50th wedding anniversary of my parents. We had friends and family staying at other hotels and condos along Kanapali, (14 of us in all) and by far, the Alii was the BEST! The staff, the cleanliness, everything was so perfect! Without a doubt the best place to stay for a relaxing retreat. The pools, the grounds, the tennis courts, the gym were superb. We highly recommend the Alii to anyone visiting Maui and we look forward to our next stay! Thanks to the staff at the Alii for all their hard work and dedication to making the Alii the best place to stay in Maui!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous in every way!”
Reviews.Author: Nancy L
Reviews.Content: Great location, beautiful unit, unbelievable view. We were in room 442 and would recommend it highly. This is our third trip, the first two being about 20 years ago. It's even better than I remembered. Love the outdoor grills and eating area. Loved the cabana with TV's to watch the Presidents Cup with other golf fans. Staff was great. Everyone always knew our names. We had family staying next door at the Westin, but most of the time they hung out at the Alii. Such a convenient location. I can't say enough....it was heaven!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value for your vacation~”
Reviews.Author: PANJCA
Reviews.Content: We've been to the Kaanapali Alli several times and look forward to spending Christmas there this year as well. This is a perfect location and place to stay for families. We are a family of four and the two bedroom two bath units are fantastic! We dont even rent a car as we can walk all around the area and there is so much to offer everyone. The beach is beautiful and clean. Just walk out front of the Alli and you can swim, surf or just lounge. They have chairs and even Cabanas you can rent for the day. It was a treat for our family to have a cabana for a day while we were there. The pool was recently renovated and is beautiful. They offer both a quiet pool and a family pool. It's great to have options. The pool is open late and they have BBQ's for you to use. They even clean them and have the utensils and all needed. Fantastic! They offer a concierge service by the pool. Beware of Wendy! She is rude and will quickly talk about the person she just helped as soon as they walk away. I saw and experienced this a few times. If Wendy is working, we go out of our way into the little pantry store and have someone else help us! The lobby is nice and the staff otherwise wonderful! The workout facility is great and included with the price. The hours are long as well. If you are on Eastern time it's great to get up early and workout before the sunrises! Great early hours! They can even arrange a massage if you ask! Great staff! Love the ability to use other hotels and charge back to our room. We can even charge at Whalers Village and have it on our room bill when we go home. It's all we could ever ask for! Cant wait to return for the holidays! We've stayed at several places in Hawaii and found this a perfect fit for our family!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed in "Premier" rating”
Reviews.Author: garelaine
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from our girl's vacation booking 1 premier ocean front and 1 premier 2 bedroom oceanfront. I have been vacationing at this resort for over 15 years with extended family and friends, so I am familiar with many of the rental units. This was the first time we experienced a small but disappointng decline in the units. One unit #464 was lacking kitchen equiptment. The other unit (#482) was also lacking decent kitchen bowls pans ect.and was very out dated. When we mentioned this the next day they did offer to move us, but we were already settled. Overall, the units were clean. Housekeeping was great. I think perhaps the owners have cut back on the quality of furnishings due to the economy?? I can remember staying in some beautifully furnished units, but when I asked if they were available, I was told they were already booked. I will probably return to this resort again, but I will check out the beds,kitchen ect. before settling in.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing vacation stay!”
Reviews.Author: kelemtrev
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4, my husband and I and our 2 children, 10 and 8 stayed at the Kaanapali Alli in December 2010. It is absolutely beautiful! The grounds were immaculate and well kept. I wish I could remember the room # we stayed in but cant....We booked through American Express and have no regrets whatsoever. It was a one bedroom with den (which was more like a 2nd bedroom with the sliding doors added for privacy) It was not considered the "premium" room and I was worried but it exceeded my expectations!!! The full size washer and dryer was an absolute lifesaver. I didn't realize how much we would appreciate having it until we were there. The kitchen was fully stocked with everything we needed. Full size stove/oven and fridge. The views were amazing! I know its more expensive but, if its possible, I highly recommend going during whale season. You don't even have to go on a whale watching trip to see them. We were sitting on the beach and glanced out toward the water and a momma and her baby both breached just off the wave break!! AMAZING!!! We watched whales from morning to night. This resort doesn't have a restaurant on site but its easily a 5 minute walk to whalers village for a lg. variety of restaurants to choose from. Oh, almost forgot, go the old Lahaina luau, its the best!

Reviews.Title: “Heaven for Families”
Reviews.Author: Christina D
Reviews.Content: We splurged on an Ocean-Front, Ocean-View, 2bd, 2ba condo and could not have been more thrilled. The unit was clean and spacious, with room for our family of five to spread out. Having a fully-equipped kitchen made it easy to eat breakfast and lunch in, and our kids actually preferred their sandwich-on-the-lanai to the one lunch at Hula Grill! Most of our days were spent going back and forth between the beach and the pools. When it rained, the kids went in the hot tubs. Great location close to Whalers Village and the Westin (for the luau). We definitely hope to return.

Reviews.Title: “huge condo”
Reviews.Author: Lee01
Reviews.Content: We booked a premier one bedroom ocean view condo. While the kitchen and bedroom were updated the furniture looked like it was from the 1980's. There were renovations taking place in the building, one day the water was turned off and there was noise daily from 9-5. Overall it was still comfortable. The beach is excellent, they offer free beach chairs but there is an additional charge for the cabana beach lounges. There is no resturant or pool side bar on site. The Westin and Marriott Beach Club allows Kaanapali Alii guest to use the resturant and bar at the hotel. The pool is rather small for the size of the resort and I would image its pretty crowded during peak season. Its a quick walk to Whaler Village which has shops and resturants.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Family Property”
Reviews.Author: RoccoInOC
Reviews.Content: We have been to Maui many times and typically stay in the Napili area. This year, we decided to stay near Kaanapali since we were bringing the kids along. We all loved the location, amenities and the general feel of the property. The beach is perfect for kids. The unit, a 1 bedroom (plus a second bedroom converted from a den) ocean view was perfect. It was nicely remodeled and provided us more than enough space. The views were incredible. After long days spent snorkeling, swimming, hanging out on the beach, the Alii was like a home-away-from-home for us. The grilling area was outstanding. It had very nice equipment and all of the necessities on hand. Condos are definitely the way to go on Maui and the Kaanapali Alii is among the best on the Island. I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Tracy g
Reviews.Content: Our family booked 3 rooms and each one was wonderful. One had a mountain view (our favorite), a pool/partial ocean view and a garden view. All were very clean, provided all of the essentials and were tastefully decorated. The staff was very friendly and always helpful! Pool was beautiful with a great grilling area and a large covered porch with lots of seating as well as flat screen TVs. Complimentary coffee was provided in the morning and fresh iced water with lemon all day. A great family atmosphere! Very nice paved beach walk for getting to local restaurants and the Whaler's Village for shopping. Free parking and no resort fees! The beach was amazing and the views were spectacular!

Reviews.Title: “Maui Memories at Kaanapali Alli”
Reviews.Author: Pettigrew_11
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Kaanapali Alli since 1986. We love the location on Dig Me Beach ! Close to great places to eat and great shopping. The pool and beach is just perfect for couples or families to enjoy. The staff is just great in every area making sure all is well. The condos have it all...views, comfortable and well equipped for all your needs. The grounds are a joy to walk through with beautiful plants and trees... as soon as we arrive we feel "at home" and enjoy every minute we are there... I cry each time we leave!

Reviews.Title: “Kaanapali Alii - Luxury without having to buy a 2 million dollar condo!”
Reviews.Author: Ron M
Reviews.Content: This was our fourtrh trip to Maui and after trying three other locations, we found luxury on Kaanapali Beach at a decent price. We went thru a popular online discounter for a packaqge of airfare, car and Condo. Our one bedroom, 2 bath ocean view condo was 1,500 SF. The owner had converted their den to a 2nd bedroom, so we actually had two bed rooms. The master bedroom, dining area and balcony Lanai overlooked the tropical pool and ocean, even though it was not oceanfront. Master shower was a two person shower, kitchen was first class, TVs in both bedrooms and living room. Equiped with everything, including washer and dryer. Daily housekeeping, covered parking at no extra charge, BBQ area, two pools, great beach with beach chaise lounges, attentive and friendly staff. Close to local restaurants and Whalers Village (shopping). Our best vacation in Maui!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely the best!”
Reviews.Author: trip0ntheg0
Reviews.Content: My kids and I have stayed here almost every year for the past 15 years. We come back because the condo is very well kept and clean, the beach is perfect, and the staff is always friendly. No complaints. When it's time for us to leave, my teenage son asks me if we're coming back the next year. We take our early morning walk along the beach, back to the condo for a quick breakfast, go to the beach, lunch in the condo, back to the beach, then either make dinner in the condo or go out. After dinner we like to take a walk to Whaler's Village. Relax and enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Experience”
Reviews.Author: Donna K
Reviews.Content: This resort was absolutely wonderful - the staff, the grounds, the condo itself, the beautiful view -- we'd really recommend this one to anyone looking for a great Maui experience.

Reviews.Title: “Alii-Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: MattyVE
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Kaanapali Alii for our honeymoon and it was fantastic! Beautiful location and condos, great staff and lots of space.

Reviews.Title: “5 stays down 1 more in 6 months”
Reviews.Author: JJ-Hendreson
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here with my family or just friends 5 different times. It is a great place! Much better than staying in a hotel and the money you can save by stopping at Costco on the way in is well worth it. I have not been there since the pool/gym upgrades but I am looking forward to it. Every place has some issues at some point. I have never had a bad experience here. I was even there when they were replacing elevators and doing construction on another unit near by. No place is ever perfect but this place is close for me. My last trip I had my 2 year old and was great to have a room that he could move around in and not just a hotel room. Cooking in a full kitchen and bbq's downstairs are great.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect In Every Way...”
Reviews.Author: Bob_Terp_Fan
Reviews.Content: The most dramatic part of any vacation is the anticipation you feel as you insert the keycard into the lock of a hotel room that you are entering for the first time - - especially after you've spent 12 hours of flying time with 3 young children to get to your destination. So you can imagine the excitement we felt when we opened the door to enter one of the most gorgeous hotel/condo units we've ever seen. We had reserved a 2BR, recently renovated suite facing the ocean and that's exactly what we got. The unit was immaculate - - clean, spacious, nicely decorated.... it was actually a luxury condo rather than a hotel room. The beds were extremely comfortable (even the sleeper sofa was nice - - usually hotel sleeper sofas are not so nice when you unfold them), the kitchen was modern and fully equipped, the bathrooms were pristine, and the condition of the overall unit was excellent. The highlight of our accommodation was that our 3rd floor lanai was literally 30 yards from one of the most beautiful beaches we have ever seen. Great for swimming and people watching as you had surfers dealing with some challenging waves while mostly newlyweds strolled the walkway extending the entire length of Kaanapali Beach ending at Whaler's Village on the north end - - a very nice shopping plaza (we saw an excellent and free hula show there). As for the kids, they didn't even miss the lack of a pool slide that a few other nearby hotels had - - dancing in the waves and attempting to body surf in the ocean right in front of the hotel was more than enough entertainment for them (and us parents as well). So when you add it all up - - central location on a beautiful stretch of beach, pleasant staff, immaculate and spacious suites, wonderful views, great amenities - - it's one of the best places you could stay at without sacrificing a bar of gold for the experience. Bravo Kaanapali Alii !!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: privatename66
Reviews.Content: Brought our 4 teenagers. Great location for them to have some independence. Beautiful beach and a very short walk to Whaler's village. Something for all of them. Would definitely go back. Nice pool area and surprisingly not overcrowded.

Reviews.Title: “SUPER AWESOME FOR FAMILIES!”
Reviews.Author: stzi
Reviews.Content: We're a family of 6, so traveling can get expensive. Staying at the Kaanapali Alii was a major treat for everyone. We easily saved $200 / day just on food, by having our own kitchen. The condo was spacious. It was listed as a 2 bedroom, but there was a room/area that had a screen door and a queen size bed. The staff was extremely nice and helpful. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: BostonBF
Reviews.Content: After leaving the Royal Hawaiian on Waikiki and heading to Maui to stay at the Kaanapali Alii, I was immediatly pleased the moment that I arrived. My partner and I stayed with another couple in an Oceanfront Premiere condo. We were greeted by a gentleman who brought us to our place and provided an overview of ther property. The condo itslef was very nice, with lots of room, 2 private bathrooms and a beautiful oceanfront lanai. There were all the comforts of home, including a washer and dryer, flat screen TV (which came in handy on a rainy day) and large sectional couch. Having a full kitchen is also great, since we did not want to go our to eat for every meal each day. I used the fitness facility every day, which was fantastic - new and spacious. I also paid to take the sunrise yoga class one morning, which was a wonderful way to start the day. The property is within easy walking distance along the ocean to Whaler's Village. I can really think of no negatives, other than the fact that once we left I received a call from one of the property managers, accusing us of damanging a bureau during our stay - we certainly did not damage anything, but perhaps next time I would do a closer inspection upon check in. Nothing more came of that. But other than that minor incident, I would highly recommend staying at Kaanapali Alii, and in fact have already booked a trip for this coming January.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice for Families- Best Stretch Of Beach”
Reviews.Author: bccrab
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the Alii and have stayed there numerous times over the years. These beautiful and well maintained condos are located on the most beautiful part of Kaanapali Beach and right in the center of the action. For a family having a kitchen can save a small fortune in Maui where breakfast alone can run well over $100 for 5 at the nearby hotel restaurants. The complex recently upgraded their pool area and the fitness center and these facilities are very nice. The stretch of beach from the Hyatt at one end to Black Rock and the Sheraton on the other end is absolutely spectacular. There are good dining options in Kaanapali along the beach walk so the fact that the Alii doesn't have a restaurant isn't a problem. Staff at the Alii from check-in to the beach staff are all friendly and welcoming. Our Condo slept 5 comfortably and had a nice balcony with an ocean view. Housekeeping service was excellent. I think this is a great choice for a family who wants more than a standard hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “We love this place!”
Reviews.Author: Bobp2322
Reviews.Content: Our family of five stayed here and absolutely fell in love with it. We had a beautiful 2 bedroom (more like a 3 bedroom) unit overlooking te ocean and pool. The staff could not have been nicer. The pool area is not huge but it is very cozy and much more quiet than the pools at the resorts on the beach. Speaking of the beach, the Alii has THE best beachfront in Kaanapali. There are 8 state of the art grills overlooking the ocean for people who want to hang out on the terrace and eat steaks while they watch the sunset. The charmingly busy oceanfront town of Lahaina is just a 10 minute drive away and it offers plenty of shopping, ice cream, people watching and food options. At night many ofthe restaurants have live music which a nice added touch. All in all, we had an amazing time, with no complaints, only great memories. We would love to return someday!!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for families. Fantastic location.”
Reviews.Author: martygSeattle_WA
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to Maui in seven months. The first time we stayed at the Ritz-Carlton in Kapalua, and were disappointed in the place, primarily because of the prevailing winds (which it is renounced for.). The Kaanapali Alii was way better. You're simply not gambling with the weather. Our condo (a two bedroom "garden" view (i.e.. parking lot view) was a little dated, and missing a few implements (e.g. spoons), but was spacious and suited us (two grandparents, my wife and I, and our two young kids) perfectly. The pool area, while not spacious like the neighboring Hyatt or Westin, suited our two young kids (5 and 3) very nicely. It is fairly small, but tastefully renovated. The adjacent BBQ arrea is excellent. What really makes this condo complex ideal is the location. Right in the heart of the beautiful Kaanapali beach. Running or meandering along the marvellous beachfront trail at dawn or dusk is just wonderful. Snorkelling with the turtles right off Kaanapali beach was a real blast. Athough it does not have a restaurant of its own, there a loads of nearby restaurants at the chain hotels and Whaler's village. We'll be back. Our very beat Hawaii vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect condo right on beach”
Reviews.Author: Porcupine99
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one bedroom premium ocean view condo. Well it was more like a 2 bedroom. Large, perfect condition, quiet. Lovely property direct beach front. Exactly as described. While the ocean view was nice I think even the garden view would have been fine. This is a first rate property. Oh and th beach location is way better than the one that fronts the hyatt. Being able to walk out of the condo and right onto a swimmable beach was one of the things we loved best about the location. I would not stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “We Love the KA”
Reviews.Author: virginiabackpacker
Reviews.Content: Family and I really enjoy the KA. Beachfront rooms are really special. BBQ area is great and the location can't be beat. Pools are good for a quick swim. Landscaping is very nice and not over-the-top like some of the resorts. We don't feel like we have to rush anywhere because we are right were we want to be for sunrise, midday, and sunset. I always enjoy trying to capture sunrise/sunset from the lanai with the camera. I feel bad complaining about my one pet peeve but, having stayed here multiple times, I noticed that the condos on the north side are exposed to hearing the fake waterfalls from the Westin property 24/7. It's not KA's fault, but when the winds aren't blowing and the surf is flat, those darn waterfalls are going constantly. Make it stop! No one really stops to look at them anyway.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful home away from home in paradise.”
Reviews.Author: famousfamos
Reviews.Content: The setting, location, ground and staff can't be beat. Ocean views and amenities all convenient to this condo. A five minute walk along the shore and restaurants galore and tons of shopping. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “A MIXED BAG”
Reviews.Author: SoCalTeacherr
Reviews.Content: While the Kaanapali Alii is awesomely located within walking distance to great snorkeling, shopping and dining, the property itself was disappointing. My husband and I booked the highest level room we could--an ocean front premier condo. What we got was a side view of the ocean on the 2nd level (not ideal for ocean views) and a condo that was outdated but for the granite countertops and stainless steel appliances. My husband checked us in, so I don't know precisely what, if anything was said, but we had booked a one bedroom and received a two bedroom instead, which leads me to conclude the "resort" was aware of our downgrade and attempted to rectify it was an additional, albeit needless, room. I thought the pool was lovely, but it does lack a bar (I don't drink a lot but the option would have been nice). I can see how it'd be a great value for families, especially families with small children, but the outdated furniture, barely functioning air conditioning (we weren't positioned to catch a breeze, so our room was perpetually stuffy and sticky), and the hard, uninviting bed disqualify the alii from being the "resort" I expected. If you want luxury and a true resort, we found it in Wailea...

Reviews.Title: “Paridise Found”
Reviews.Author: jovaninwegen
Reviews.Content: We planned a family trip to Maui to celebrate our 50th wedding anniversary (3 years early!). We thought it would be a trip of a lifetime and it was, but we are already thinking about when we can return. We chose the Kaanapali Alii since two 2-bdrm, 2 bath condos met our family's needs. It was fabulous! The rooms were well decorated and very beautiful. The mountain view was breathtaking especially when the beautiful rainbow appeared in our window, without any rain! We loved the gorgeous beaches and pools. One of the highlights of our trip was grilling out on the grills provided by the Alii. We have told our friends about this beautiful place. We would choose the Alii again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Condo on Kaanapali!! hands down”
Reviews.Author: SeattleTvlAgent
Reviews.Content: EXCELLENT way to get great beach, location, quality and full kitchen condos with class! nice grounds, BBQs, nice pool, walking distance to Whalers Village, No parking fee, no resort fees... 1 and 2 bedroom units, large!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Families”
Reviews.Author: CoastMommy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our 2 kids (ages 2 1/2 and 6 mos) for 10 days. The condo was fabulous - 2 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, and a full, equiped kitchen. Sits directly in between the Westin and Marriot on Kaanapali Beach. Bring a stroller for little ones, and you can walk everywhere. The pools are perfect, and there is even a kiddie pool that's 18 inches deep. My brother and his family stayed at the Westin (which is also superb if you want a regular hotel room) and his kids liked our pool better (ages 2 1/2 and 1 yr). The outside barbeque area is wonderful, beach front and equipped (paper plates, utensiles, napkins, etc) so you just bring your food and drinks down and grill practically right on the beach. Everyone (except the rude lady at checkin) was fantastic! We only met one employee who didn't belong there, but fortunately, everyone else made up for it. I really can't say enough about how wonderful this place was.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay-Awesome Location”
Reviews.Author: Mitch056
Reviews.Content: Just got back the end of May and had a great time at the Alli. There were 3 couples so we had a 3BR Partial Ocean View looking at the Mariott (Bldg#3). Plenty of room and a really nice view. Suite could be updated to a more modern look but everything was clean and staff were all very friendly and helpful. The beach here is the best! Very close to Whalers Village and all the major hotels. Pool area is nice and even had 2 big screen TV's to watch hockey! Complimentary morning coffee by the pool and lots of towels! The new fitness centre is excellent. 2nd time we've stayed here and thoroughly enjoyed it!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Resort”
Reviews.Author: dpakc
Reviews.Content: We just spent a week at the Kaanapali Alii and it was amazing. We had a 2 bedroom oceanfront which also had a view of The westin pool area, the beach and black rock. We rented thru vrbo.com. The staff is excellent. The location is perfect. Large sand beach between the Marriott and the Westin. A short walk to Whaler's Village. The kids enjoyed the surf lessons in front of the Marriott, with Bennie. Also, the ziplines at Kaanapali were a blast.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing - I didn't want to leave!”
Reviews.Author: nsebastian
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from our stay at the Alii and I already want to plan our return trip! The staff was incredibly friendly and were always available when we needed anything. We didn't have an upgraded premier unit, but ours was very comfortably furnished and everything was in very good condition. At night it was quiet and we slept well having the bedroom window open to hear the ocean at night. It was wonderful having access to a kitchen for breakfast and lunch - it saved us from having to go out or order in for every meal of the trip. We had unit 182 which had a great view of the ocean and beach, pool and even a bit of the mountains from the lanai. The pool area was *wonderful*. It's set back a bit from the main walkway along the beach for privacy and they have a pool and hot tub designated as the "Quiet Pool" for adults which is a bit separated from the main and kiddie pool area which was great for us. The landscaping and flowers were stunning, and at night the pools are lit up in blue with plenty of torches along the walkways. The pool was just across the beach walk from the sand and ocean, and they provided towels and chairs for us to use on the sand as well. The beach walk provided great access to Leilani's, Tropico and Whaler's Village and was great to take morning walks/runs. You can't beat the Alii for a great time in Maui! It's so nice to have space to spread out and not be cramped into a tiny hotel room. The location is perfect for everything that you'd need on the island, the staff is great and the views are just breathtaking. We'll definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “You don't need to look any further than the Kaanapali Alii in Maui.”
Reviews.Author: dallastraveler55711
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Kaanapali Alii several times. Each time we return our visit is better than the last! Located right on the beach, the Kaanapali offers ocean view rooms. We open our windows at night and are lulled to sleep by the ocean. Can't get any better than that! Our accomodations are always 5-star. The management sees to it that every guest is treated like royalty! You truly feel that you are in paradise! Each staff member really seems to like his/her job. They are so patient to answer any and all questions. We don't think you will be disappointed at the Alii-------located close to Whaler's Village, dining, and shopping! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic - Luxury and Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: tomzimm
Reviews.Content: This condo (312) was beautiful! Walked out onto our patio onto the lawn and down to the beach. Our kids (12 and 10) just loved it. Walking distance to shopping and resorts. Absolutely beautiful and would love to go back. Great workout area, grill area, pools and the beach is spectacular. We stayed for nine days and would have loved to stay for nine more. The place is spotless and the staff is extremely helpful and conscientious. Can't imagine staying anywhere else on Maui.

Reviews.Title: “SIMPLY THE BEST”
Reviews.Author: avoma42
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best places in all of Hawaii to stay. Across the board your needs are met.... staff is knowledgable and professional and concerned about their guests. Site is spotlessly well maintained. Location is outstanding. I'd have to think long and hard to find something to complain about. Well worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury home away from home - with a maid!!! Simply Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Robinstrip
Reviews.Content: This exclusive condo was so nice to come home to! Kids just wanted to go back to the condo for a swim. Right on the beach. walking distance to shopping and resorts. This is heaven!!! Excellent warm and friendly staff that remember your name. Security guards on the grounds make sure your stay is safe and nice. Manicured lawns and gardens. Pools , spas, workout building, barbeques, everthing was perfect! I have to buy a new bed now because the mattresses were so comfortable, I have never slept as well anywhere! LOL.

Reviews.Title: “Most Units are Nice, but be Careful”
Reviews.Author: rfriedman70
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here six times. This time we were disappointed. We had an ocean front room 2 bedroom condo with a wonderful view, but the room was shabby and poorly furnished (#385). It is not just a matter of needing to be updated; it is unpleasant and detracts considerably from the good feeling we hoped to have (and think we deserve for $700 a night.) Management ignored our request for help. They did not even call us back. Do not let them give you this unit until they can promise that it has been fixed up. Our recommendation below is based on other units in this property and the prayer that you do not need any help from management.

Reviews.Title: “If I lived on the West Coast, I would think about buying property here....”
Reviews.Author: MilesHouse
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 8 nights at the Alii with our 2.5 year old daughter and 7 month old son. I did some research in advance and wanted to make sure that the place was set up for the kids when we arrived. On Trip Advisor, I read about Akami Mothers which is a service on Maui that rents baby equipment at very reasonable prices. We had cribs, high chairs, beach toys, jumperoos, etc. delivered, set up, and in our room when we arrived. Upon entering our unit we were amazed at the spacious size. Nearly 2000 square feet!!! The kitchen was totally up to date and user friendly as we ate most meals at home. The Safeway in Lahina is about 3 miles down the road and was where we did all of our shopping. There were flat panels in all rooms which was nice. Our particular unit did not have wifi which was a bummer but not the end of the world (it did have internet). The furnishings were a little outdated and the showerheads were not the best, but for the amount of space and overall comfort of the unit, I didn't think twice about it. Every unit is different so check on yours before renting. We had an oceanfront view from our lanai, and ate breakfast many mornings out there watching the day get started. Moving to the property itself, parking was crowded but I always had a spot. There is a convenience store on the property for last minute items which is great (we ran out of milk one day and made an emergency run for the kids). The pool is absolutely terrific. The kids pool is not fancy but a terrific space for young children like ours. We met other families easily, and my daughter always had someone to play with. The pool can get a little crowded as seating in the shade is limited, but everyone is nice and will make room for another chair. There were plenty of barbeques in the pool area and people shuttling down the elevators with their marinated meat and fishes. There were some flat panels by the pool, flavored water, and towels with chair covers available. The beach is right there, and if you don't want to rent their cabanas think about renting your own chairs and umbrellas (we did through Akami Mothers). I believe they have chairs on the beach available too for free but we spent most of our time at the pool. I don't know where else on Maui you will find almost 2000 square feet at these prices. If you like a spacious apartment feel, cooking, and a laid back clientele across alll types (young families, teens, retired, couples) this is the place. No Evian spritzes or bar service, but homemade margritas and wine in environmentally friendly mugs that you bring. Or, walk down to one of the many resorts and enjoy a drink poolside....With our children asleep, we took a stroller walk down the beach front to the Sheraton pool bar, and enjoyed the afternoon. The Alii has agreements to charge drinks and food at many of the resorts back to your room. If I lived on the West Coast, my wife and I would love to own a property like this. Before having kids, we loved vacationing at luxury resorts like the Four Seasons. With kids, comes the need for kitchens and space. Why spend $1,000-$2,000 a night when you can have more space, the feel of a home, and a prime location with a terrific pool. Hope this helps make your decision.....We were not disappointed and loved our stay at the Alii....

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful home away from home in the heart of Kaanapali Beach”
Reviews.Author: RaincitySue
Reviews.Content: We stayed for eight days in the beautiful Kaanapali Alii located between the Westin and Marriott on Kaanapali beach. Our unit was a two bedroom, two bath with an additional den bedroom. The ocean views were spectacular, unit was large (about 1900 sq ft) and beautifully appointed. The kitchen was fully equipped so we could eat in when we chose. Whaler's Village for nightlife, shopping and great restaurants was just a few minutes walk down the beach. Even though the Alii was fully booked when we were there, it never felt crowded and was quiet at night. The Alii advertises one and two bedrooms but many of the two bedroom units have dens which have been converted into a third bedroom. If you need a third bedroom, ask for a den unit when booking. We were travelling with three teenagers, two girls and a boy, so the third bedroom was really nice.

Reviews.Title: “This place was perfect again... we had a terrific stay. It gets better each time.”
Reviews.Author: hollis91
Reviews.Content: We have been here several times over the years but the upgrades to the property with new pools and fitness center are great. the staff went out of there way to make it a great stay. We have tried other places on the island but they never compared to coming back to the Alii.

Reviews.Title: “Maui's Best”
Reviews.Author: jaymaui
Reviews.Content: If you are looking at staying at the best that Maui has to offer you need to contact the Kaanpalii Alii. This is the best place to stay, without exception. The staff are excellent, the location is the best on the island, and the accomodations are 5 star. We have been here over 15 times and will never consider anywhere else and always reccomend freinds and family to the Alii. You cannot go wrong!!

Reviews.Title: “"Smelled & looked like "old people"”
Reviews.Author: laplume9254
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Kaanapali Alii the nights of December 16th & 17th in unit 222. We booked a garden view, premier room at the resort. As Marriott Maui timeshare owners, we always admired the property and vowed to one day stay there. How disappointed we were with our stay. Check in was smooth, but as soon as we opened the unitâ€™s door, we were unpleasantly surprised. My daughter said it best, â€œMom, this looks and smells like old people Floridaâ€�. With the exception of the bathrooms, this unit looks like it has not been redecorated nor updated since the Alliâ€™s opening. We laid towels on the sofa to sit on it, the dishes that we used were dirty and needed to be washed, and the bedding had an odor to it. Either the tile or the carpeting was so dirty that our feet were black if we walked barefoot in the unit. While using the disposal for a small amount of apple peels, the sink clogged so badly that a â€œsnakeâ€� had to be used to clear the blockage. It resulted in a maintainence man being in the unit one hour in the evening, producing a strong odor when the blockage was removed. If this was a premier room, I would hate to see the condition of a standard room. I could not wait to leave the property. My husband and I did not complain to the desk clerk on departure as there was a long line of guests. We travel to Maui twice a year, one week at our timeshare and the other week staying at various other properties around the island. We would be hard pressed to stay at, or recommend the Kaanapali Alli to friends and family. Paying a daily rate at the Marriott Ocean Club or the Westin Villas would be more luxurious, clean and reliable.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved it”
Reviews.Author: waxyboy
Reviews.Content: For a young family (kids are 7 & 9yo) the Kaanapali Alii was the perfect place for us to stay at. It started the moment we pulled in at 10pm with 2 sleeping kids in the car when one of the bellboys did everything possible to ensure we could transition the kids to bed as quickly and as quietly as we could. We booked a 1 bed Ocean View Premier through Kay (www.mauikay.com). Didn't need the 2 bed as we put the kids in the master bedroom and the adults in the den. Worked out very well. The condo was huge with new decor. Could live in it if we had to. Our room was in building 1 9th floor facing to the north so we had views of the beaches and the mountains Location was great. Only a short walk to Leilani village for all our needs. Also not too far to the Sheraton which was great for snorkelling with the fish and turtles. We used the bbq's a couple of times. All clean and quite sociable. Pools were also great as expected Must put in a plug for Kay as she came to see us the morning after we arrived and advised us on what we could do. We arranged some activities through her which was effortless. Would like to find a Kay at each holiday destination we visit.

Reviews.Title: “Kaanapali Perfec t for us”
Reviews.Author: coast97388
Reviews.Content: We stayed a week and half at upscale Kaanapali Alii #353 on the Fifth Floor. via VBO. Wonderful views from every room and lanai. We were very comfortable with 4 adults and children ages 1 & 5. We never felt cramped as the living dining kitchen area is spacious. The bedrooms are large, bathrooms very nice with updated granite vanity and rock floors and showers. The guest bedroom has 2 full beds, but enough room to fit in a crib leaving at least 3 feet to walk past the crib at the end of the beds. We rented the crib, high chair and stroller from Akamai Mothers, who gave us great service and even delivered the stroller at the last minute as we discovered at the airport that Mom decided not to bring the stroller from home. Akamai prices seemed lower than the other rental agencies, but you can find a whole list of baby rental places on line to choose from. The entire resort is immaculate. The resort staff quietly is working not only on the beautiful landscaping, but the pool, wiping down all the furniture, even the open shower to get the sand off you or to rinse off the pool water is wiped down top to bottom daily. Very friendly staff and relaxed pool, great for little children and hot tub for adults. Great location on Kaanapali Beach, walk along the beach path to restaurants, shopping at Whalers Village , Luau's, Black Rock, beach activity. We would return in a minute

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Place-But careful when booking”
Reviews.Author: Passingthorugh
Reviews.Content: We have stayed her in the past and as always these units are amazing. HOWEVER, when we booked 6 months ago we booked a 1 bdrm premier ocean view unit with a lanai. We got here and when we got to our room we were in a room facing the golf course? We did have one window that had a partial view of the ocean. The manager and staff person were not very helpful in dealing with our frustration. The manager also admitted they have had this problem in the past where people booked a room they thought was a ocean view and it was only a partial view so 2 months ago they retitled their room categories to reflect this. She said that the room I booked (1 bdrm ocean view lanai premier means that the ocean view is only from the lanai. She said others thought they had a view of the Island of Lanai which meant a total ocean view. So after several hours dealing with our travel agent we were unable to upgrade unless we wanted to eat the cost. Since these are personal owned units they are bound by contract and cannot offer upgrades, etc which we totally understand. So when you book be sure to be very very specific what you want. All units have a lanai and they have renamed the unit category that we now have to be " 1 bdrm partial ocean view premier. They took out the work lanai and put in partial ocean view to reflect exactly what it is. Service is great. I wish they would go wireless with the internet service. Every condo owner has different choices. Some are wireless and some are not but either way you have to pay for the service. The cost for us using ethernet connection was $11.95 per day charged to credit card through a separate company. They do have weekly and monthly rates. These rates are for a 24 hour period from the time you sign up for the service.. It would be nice if the entire complex when wireless like all most others in the area. It would be a small fee for the entire building ownership and it could still be passed on for a daily service but every unit having different options is not very practical. I bet there are some that don't have any internet if it is up to each owner so if you really need access you may ask at time of booking.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: darkbeergirl
Reviews.Content: I went at the last minute with my good friend and her husband and 8 year old twin boys. The condo had just been remodeled and it is beautiful but I understand not all of the units are updated. I would have liked clean sheets every day but that was my fault for not stripping the bed. I had to sleep in sand on occasion. I stayed in the "den" which was a little space off of the living room with it's own bath that was separated by sliding closet style doors that kept out zero noise so if anyone else in the unit was up, so was I. However it was steps from the ocean and had a fabulous common area with pools, hot tubs and bar-b-ques.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, value, rooms and beach.”
Reviews.Author: swoony11
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just got back from a week at the Kaanapali Alii with friends for the Maui Invitational and really enjoyed our stay. The rooms were very nice and comfortable. The resort was generally quite (although there seemed to be a lot of kids and no where for them to play), the beach was perfect, the staff was very nice and the grounds were well kept. It was a great location with walkable access to shops, restaurants and other hotels. The entire area felt very safe and we really enjoyed our stay. The pools aren't quite as over the top as some of the hotel resorts near by but you have everything you need. The grilling area and tv areas were a neat touch as well although not having a bar was sometimes a pain (but much cheaper!)

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service, spacious updated condo”
Reviews.Author: alel_stl
Reviews.Content: We stayed in condo 431 from September 17th-24th. This condo was one of two garden view rooms requested by our travel agent. The condo was very nice. It was technically a "garden view" room but we actually had a great ocean view from the lanai, living room and kitchen and a mountain view from the lanai, dining room and bedroom. It was also technically a 1 bedroom with a den but the den was a second bedroom with an en-suite bathroom. The condo was completely renovated and the kitchen had everything we needed (except for a cocktail shaker but we brought one along assuming it isn't a standard thing). The condo was spacious and the master bedroom was separated from the rest of the living area which was great for my daughter's nap time. The den area (second bedroom) had a pocket door so it was completely separate from the living room. We had to be a bit quiet in the living room when we would first put my daughter down for the night but most night we spent our time on the lanai anyway. The only real negative I had with the condo was the bed in the master bedroom. It seemed really nice at first but it felt quite lumpy after only a night. There were definitely indentations where people normally sleep. We ended up sleeping sideways on the bed each night and that was the only thing that made it comfortable. The double bed in my daughter's room was really comfortable though. I think the master just needs a new mattress. The condo has a washer and dryer which was wonderful. They even give you detergent for the washer and dryer. I probably did a couple of loads of laundry while we were there and ended up coming home with mostly clean clothes and not a pile of laundry. The staff at the resort is wonderful. The bellman that showed us to our room was very friendly and gave us quite the introduction to the resort. The pool staff was friendly and ready to help. Most places I have stayed get really weird about pool towels (handing in passes, keys, etc to get a towel). They were very laid back about it. They have chairs on the beach you can use for free or you can rent a cabana for $40/day. We rented a cabana a few days and loved it. The BBQ area at the resort is really nice too. They supply the tools, foil, paper plates, plastic silverware, etc. There are 6(?) huge grills and we never had any issue using one. It does get busy down there around 6pm though. The fitness center at the resort is really nice too with top of the line equipment. Each cardio machine has a tv on it and an adapter for your iPod as well. The location of the resort is the best for Kannapali. It is a 5 minute walk to the Whaler's Village- shopping, restaurants, fast food, ABC store, etc. The Westin is right next door with a couple of restaurants (and a fantastic Luau) as well. Black Rock (great snorkeling) is about a ten minute walk up the beach. There is a boardwalk that runs from the Hyatt to the Sheraton which is great for people watching and running. Lahaina (downtown area) is about a 5 minute car ride. All in all- definitely a great property all around. I will definitely be back here on a future trip.

Reviews.Title: “I Would Definitely Stay at the Alii Again”
Reviews.Author: margob1034
Reviews.Content: We were at the Alii last week, and what a great place to be. Our room, 1111, was a premier partial ocean view room. The lanai had a golf course, Westin and partial ocean view while the dining room and master bedroom had an ocean view. At night we could listen and see the luau at the Westin. We pulled in and within 5 minutes our car had been parked, our luggage had been unloaded and they were taking us to our room. Ten minutes after getting in our room, the front desk called to make sure everything was to our liking in our room. The one bedroom premier rooms have a den with a murphy bed so it could be considered another bedroom. No bar and the room service is provided by the Westin. We will definitely stay here again even though they charge for the wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Alii!!”
Reviews.Author: AllenFamof5
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 11 nights and had the best time ever! Maui is always great, but the Alii far exceeded our expectations. From the moment we arrived until we left, we felt as though we were at a 5 star hotel, not a condo. Location is perfect, grounds are immaculate, and rooms are kept spotless with daily maid service. We definitely will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “The Kaanapali Alii is simply one of the best ways to enjoy Maui .”
Reviews.Author: albertatraveller66
Reviews.Content: I along with 3 members of my family stayed at the Kaanapali Alii in August 2010 for 10 days.We just keep coming back to the Alii!!!! The accomodations are superlative, 1600 sq feet of total comfort, the staff absolutely great, the location is in close proximity within a 5 minute walk to the Whalers Village and the beach and scenery breath-taking. The pool area has been re-done in a way to enhance ones stay when relaxing by the pool....you really have to try it! From our balcony we overlooked the beach and ocean and when enjoying a glass of wine it just doesn't get any better than that.......Alberta travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!!”
Reviews.Author: TXTraveler49
Reviews.Content: The Kaanapali Alii was everything we hoped for and more! We stayed in an oceanfront premier 2 bedroom and it was worth every penny! We had two teenagers and a younger child with us for ten days and at the same price as two hotel rooms, we had so much more room, more conveniences and all the luxuries. The views were stunning from the kitchen, living room and both bedrooms. Large living room and bedrooms with flat screen TVs in all three. The kitchen was outstanding with granite, sub zero frig, etc., everything top of the line and was fully outfitted with cookware, small appliances, BBQ gear. The staff was great, from the front desk to the housekeeping staff to the pool desk, who even remembered our name after the first day. We had never stayed in a condo before and now we are spoiled - can't imagine going back to a hotel again after this great experience. Highly recommend these accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous....just sit back and enjoy.”
Reviews.Author: vacation078
Reviews.Content: From the moment you enter the property you know you made the right choice.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Place to Stay on Kaanapali Beach!”
Reviews.Author: robnkellie
Reviews.Content: We surprised our twin daughters with a graduation vacation back to Maui and also celebrated a milestone birthday for me during our stay from June 10-17th. This was our 4th trip as a family back to Kaanapali Alii and we have never been disappointed! We have previously stayed at the Sheraton, Westin, and Whaler (condos) before finding the Alii. We have had premier oceanfront, ocean view, and lanai ocean view and all have been beautifully decorated with granite countertops, stainless steel appliances, etc. It is so much nicer to spread out and have a kitchen, and living area to relax in rather than stay in a hotel. We haven't cooked a meal at the Alii but the condos are all well stocked with dishes, utensils and pots and pans. There are also BBQ's and outdoor dining tables near the beach. The beach in front of the property is the best beach along Kaanapali. It is very big and open. They have someone who takes your beach chair out for you and picks it up when you leave. You can also check out a towel for the beach around the pool. The Kaanapali Alli staff is very friendly and always eagar to help. They have housekeeping that makes your bed, straightens up your condo, and leaves fresh towels everyday. The newly remodeled and expanded pool is gorgeous along with the grounds and the new gym is state of the art. The location is right near Whaler's Village which has many shops and restaurants including a small food court with McDonalds. A new addition to the Village this past year is Yogurtland. Lahaina is just 5 minutes away with a nice Safeway store and a Starbucks. We buy all our groceries here and don't miss the fresh papaya. Lahaina has lots of shops and great dining options. There is a lot to do in the area also. We parasailed this last trip with UFO parsailing company and it left right near the hotel. It was a real thrill and we loved it! We also jet skiied. You can play golf, go visit the volcano, take a train ride, horseback ride, snorkel and sail, or take a drive to Kihei and shop at the Grand Wailea Shops. Watching the sunset here is also one of the best you will ever see. Our favorite restuarants include Hula Grill, and Leilani's on Kaanapali Beach, The Plantation House in Kapalua, Cheeseburger in Paradise, and Kimo"s in Lahaina. We have traveled a lot as a family, but no matter where we go, Kaanapali Beach and the Alii has always been our favorite vacation spot! We always have a great time and bring home many fond memories of our vacations here. It is the only vacation spot we are sad to leave and can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on Earth”
Reviews.Author: kcanez
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Kaanapali Alii last October and can't say enought great things about our trip. The unit we stayed in was right on the beach with fabulous ocean views and easy convienence to the walk path and beach. The interiors were beyond amazing! The Alii was so close to everything in Kaanapali.....the shops, restaurants, beach and snorkeling. The staff was always so helpful with any request like renting cabanas and pulling out chaise lounges to the beach. Such a relaxing week! From the moment of check-in to the moment at check-out the staff were so friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Condo 364- Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Bonnie28_10
Reviews.Content: I stayed in condo 364 for my sister's bachelorette party. The condo was perfect! Great view, great weather, comfy beds, decorated beautifully. My favorite was the rain head showers. I can't wait to go back. I will always ask for condo room 364. Aloha

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way!”
Reviews.Author: 4OurVacations
Reviews.Content: Unit 364 Kaanapali Alii~Paradise on Maui!!! Unbeatable beachfront location on a large "swimmable" beach. Completely remodeled, beautiful Hawaiian furnishings & artwork, gourmet kitchen w/ designer appliances, large private balcony w/ dining set and lounge chairs, lovely partial ocean view from master brdm...you can hear/see the ocean waves! Internet, A/C, washer/dryer in unit, peaceful,spotless pool area, gourmet gas BBQ grills~all right off Kaanapali beach boardwalk! If you stock up at Costco, you will never want or need to leave the Alii! This unit is absolutely the perfect place for anyone! It is very well appointed with a king bed+beautiful master bath, 2 comfy double beds and large lovely bath, a den area that has a very comfortable Murphy double bed+ample storage- with fabulous plantation doors creating a private room. There is a spacious living room, dining area & flat screen TV's in every room! We appreciated the unit being immaculate and smoke free. The mangement truly offers premier service and courtesy with every encounter... from the reception, the activities directors, groundskeepers, housekeeping staff, etc. What we liked most....The owners made #364 a "home" with a warm feel of "aloha" throughout! Can't wait to return! What we liked the least.....Departing!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise defined”
Reviews.Author: BobAmos
Reviews.Content: Until you have experienced the Kaanapali Alii you really have not experienced The Hawaii Dream. Everything you have ever wanted Hawaii to be can be found there or immediately nearby. Recreation, Food, Shopping, Beach, Golf and on and on. It is all here at the "Alii". The only negative I can think of is not being able to consider another trip to Maui without having it include a stay at the "Kaanapali Alii".

Reviews.Title: “Kaanapali Alii is the best!”
Reviews.Author: ssparkyg
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week long stay at the Kaanapali Alii with our 18 year old son and 16 year old daughter. This was our sixth visit to the Alii. This condominium/hotel is even better than it used to be with a brand new pool and workout facility added since our last visit in 2008. This property is superbly located on Kaanapali Beach between the Marriott and the Westin. It is walking distance to Whaler's Village and all the restaurants. The most impressive part of the Alii is the rooms. They are privately owned and decorated with more than just hotel room furniture. The one bedroom we stayed in had an ocean view and a murphy bed on the wall which allowed this one bedroom to sleep 4 (with one on the couch). The kitchen also allows us to save a little money by eating breakfast and lunch at home. If you plan to go to Maui and want to stay in an upscale room that is much larger than a typical hotel room, this is the place!

Reviews.Title: “Gotta Love The Alii!!”
Reviews.Author: skatz927
Reviews.Content: Kaanapali Alii was recommended by friends and I looking for a condo where we (family of 4) could have more space versus a standard hotel room. We booked in February for an August stay and requested an oceanview and a high floor. When we arrived, we were put into a beautiful 3rd floor condo (of 11 floors) with what i considered a partial view. Needless to say, I was not thrilled. I requested a move later that day but was told that there was nothing available. The next morning, I spoke to someone with authority and the next think i knew, we were moved to a 10thf loor condo with sweeping views of the Pacific and Molokai. I was very pleased with the service, not to mention the location of the property (great beach). Would definitely stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfection!”
Reviews.Author: FrankInSWFla
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Kaanapali Alii was during the month of July, 2010. I was a bit apprehensive about booking at a non-luxury, non-chain hotel. However, from the time we stepped onto the property, those concerns vanished. Staying at the Kaanapali Alii was like having a rich uncle who offered to let you use his infrequently visited luxury condo. The location was fantastic. The room was exquisite (well, maybe not "exquisite", but really nice). Without exception, the employees at Kaanapali Alii were top notch.
