We are not high maintenance travelers, therefor did not need much. But, the employees were always ready and willing to assist with anything we needed... and they did so in a very warm, friendly, sincere way. I look forward to rebooking at the same location when I return. Pros: Location, view, staff, amenities Cons: No poolside bar

Reviews.Title: “Always love the Alii”
Reviews.Author: nevadatraveler87
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 5-day stay at the Alii after visiting Kauai and found the renovations and new look to be great. The rooms, the grounds, and the view are spectacular and the location is fantastic. We had no problems and would recommend the Alii to anyone. We were in a premier oceanfront condo and it was recently remodeled and looked great. Housekeeping staff were very helpful as well.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Vacation”
Reviews.Author: DBrown2
Reviews.Content: I chose this location to celebrate my 35th wedding anniversary after reading several other reviews and I'm absolutely glad I did. From the moment we arrived I truly felt like a VIP. The staff was outstanding, the rooms spacious and furnished beautifully. The 10th floor ocean front view took my breath away. I didn't want to leave. In fact my mind is still there. It was a short walk to Whaler's Village and nearby hotels. Costco is close to the airport and makes it convenient to save on eating out. I can't wait to return and highly recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a first class vacation with the comforts of home in the perfect location on Kaanapali Beach.

Reviews.Title: “Best accomodation value on the island”
Reviews.Author: KHAYFAM
Reviews.Content: We did some homework before settling on the Kaanapali Alii for a one week family vacation in July. Our one-bedroom, garden view Unit #222 appeared to have recently been renovated, had a real sense of luxury to it. We were looking for accommodation with all the amenities of home and the Alli really delivered. A den converted to a 2nd bedroom added welcomed sleeping space, including an ensuite and shower that our 2 teens appreciated. Talking to folks staying at neighboring properties, we now know thereâ€™s excellent value in staying at the Alli. The location is central to the resort area and to activities. Itâ€™s beach is expansive and clean with a magnificent view of Lanai. Location is close to Whalers Village with nearby restaurants and evening entertainment. I agree with comments regarding car rental. Thereâ€™s way to much to experience around the island to go without. And grocery shopping is a must. Parking at the Alii was free which added to the value. The Alli staff could not have been friendlier. The facility and grounds were kept in immaculate condition. In our opinion, this beach front Condo Complex is the best property on Kaanapali Beach. Thanks Alli, my wife and boys and I are already looking forward to a return visit next year.

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: Ventinonfatlatte
Reviews.Content: "Wow" was the first word that came out of my mouth when I saw the view. We had a 2 BR/2 Bath corner unit on the 8th floor w/a gorgeous mtn. view. Marble tile & carpet throughout, kitchen w/granite counter tops and dark cherry wood cabinetry and stainless steel appliances, 2 full beds in the second bedroom that our 3 kids slept comfortable in, a roomy master bedroom w/a king canopy bed, large area in both bathrooms to change in, a long beautiful entry hallway w/laundry room near the front door, 2 eat-in tables that can accomodate 10, 3 flat screen TV's. The condo was so spacious, clean, and had such a beautiful view that we were happy just being in the condo! Parking was free, staff was very helpful & friendly, the 2 pools and 2 hot tubs and wading pool area are clean & beautifully landscaped, the beach is right there where you can rent the lounge chair canopies, there are very nice BBQ grills surrounded by tables & chairs near the pool area. What the Ali'i does not have is a dining establishment or room service, a grand open-air lobby like you see in other hotels, and although the pool is very nice the area is rather small compared to surrounding hotels. So if you need all these amenities, the Westin Villas may be more up your alley, but more expensive. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Unit #183 Fantastic Accommodations”
Reviews.Author: mjcornelius
Reviews.Content: Perfectly appointed unit. Clean, comfortable, modern accommodations in great location. Everything you'll need for a wonderfully relaxing vacation.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place to stay and get away from it all.”
Reviews.Author: ridercon
Reviews.Content: The location is terrific, close to all. The service was friendly, responsive, and very good. The property was in pristine shape, from the roomâ€™s interior to the grounds and tennis courts, one of the prettiest settings around, and quiet. We played tennis, watched whales, swam in the ocean and pool, sunned on the beach, BBQed and we did all this without leaving the grounds or driving anywhere. Shopping was a short walk down the beach. One of the best vacations, in a long time. This place has it ALL!!!

Reviews.Title: “Waking up in paradise daily”
Reviews.Author: oshii
Reviews.Content: It was truly the best vacation we have taken yet. The hotel was clean, convenient, beautiful, located right on the beach. It was nice to utilize the barbeque gas grills by the pool for the evenings we just wanted to cook at home. The suite we stayed in was perfect in all aspects. The upgraded appliances worked great, and the sun set view being on the 8th floor was breathtaking every night from the balcony. I would highly recommend the Kaanapali Alii if you want luxury, comfort, service, convenience, and beauty all at your fingertips daily. There is nothing else you need. They take care of everything so all you need to do is relax, enjoy, and create memories that will last a lifetime.

Reviews.Title: “What a Nice Surprise!”
Reviews.Author: Maverick1111
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I spent a week at the Alii in May. We stayed in unit 232, a one-bedroom garden view unit that has been updated. While we enjoyed the spaciousness of the condo, we were pleasantly surprised with the partial ocean view we had from the living room and lanai. We had expected to have a view of tropical foliage, and got a view of the ocean instead. The Alii is on the best part of Kaanapali Beach, and we divided our time between the beach and the newly-renovated pool area. There were plenty of free beach chairs and we never had a problem getting a lounge around the pool. We cooked in many nights and everything we needed was supplied in the kitchen. The in-room washer and dryer was very convenient and detergent is supplied. The staff was very friendly and helpful. It was a very relaxing vacation, and we can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: BeachBound360
Reviews.Content: This is a terrific family destination. There is a tremendous amount of fun for the kids that the Alii offers. The new pool and workout center are second to none. It is also just across the streeet from terrific golfing, shops and restuarants (Leilanis Mai Tai's!). I don't think you can beat that value of the Alii anywhere on Maui. Great Staff, beautiful location and all the amenities you need.

Reviews.Title: “It was my best trip to Hawaii because of the facility; location, friendly service,and quality surroundings.”
Reviews.Author: Tome48
Reviews.Content: As I said above, Alii made my vacation. The facility is high quality with very nice surroundings and lots to do: tennis, gym, spa, pools, and beautiful beach. The employees were so friendly and responsive. I looked forward to early morning coffee in the outdoor television area adjacent to the pools. It was a nice, friendly gathering spot for all. The location is perfect: right on the beach walkway, near but not too close to shops and restaurants. It seemed like everything was a pleasant 5 to 10 minute walk. If you want to be assured of having a wonderful vacation choose the Alii.

Reviews.Title: “The View From Our Unit Took My Breath Away”
Reviews.Author: lavidarica
Reviews.Content: First time here and I will definately be back. Loved the spaceous and beautifully decorated 2 bedrm unit 1105 on the 10th floor. When I first entered the panoramic views of the ocean with the nearby islands took my breath away. Everything in this newly remodeled unit was top quality: decor, bedding, beautifully equipped kitchen, high end flat screen TV's, etc... This place really made me happy and relaxed. And the grounds, pools, and workout facility were equally impressive. Well designed, well maintained and very clean. The staff were so friendly, professional and very informative. The Kaanapali Alii is the best spot on the best beach with great restaurants and shopping within 5 minutes down the beachside pathway.

Reviews.Title: “Revitalization in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: PEO-Man
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have been married for 22 years and never have had a vacation without the children. A couple we know told us about this place, Kaanapali Alii, in Hawaii. Everyone wants to go to Hawaii so we looked into it. Upon arrival we were taken back as we traveled from the airport to the condo of the vast beauty of the island Maui. When we arrived at Kaanapali Alii we were treated as royalty, they we expecting us. Check in took no time and they took us up to the condo. The view was so breathe taking, we were looking out at the number 1 beach in Maui! They explained everything we needed to know about the resort and best places on the beach to eat and shop. We wanted to just get tan and relax and thatâ€™s exactly what we did. We also went sightseeing, the trip to Hana, great all day trip. We also recommend just driving around the island looking at all the waterfalls and hidden away beaches. When I retire I would love to make this our second home.

Reviews.Title: “Alii Rules!”
Reviews.Author: miniwalt
Reviews.Content: Stayed a week at the Kaanapali Alii for the first time. We have stayed on Kaanapali Beach many times in the past and have stayed numerous times at the Westin, the Whaler and once at the Marriott. My wife and I were married at the Westin Maui. Needless to say we love Kaanapali Beach. The Alli was the best experience we have had. We stayed in a two bedroom ocean front on the eleventh floor. The staff could not have been friendlier. The accommodations were kept immaculate. In my opinion, the beach fronting the hotel is the best part of Kaanapali beach, wide clean, good for swimming or snorkeling. The money we saved by buying and cooking our own food, 5 of the seven nights, easily paid for a night or two of staying here. Do it.

Reviews.Title: “the perfect hotel in the best location”
Reviews.Author: CFeuz
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Alli and were extremely impressed with our "condo unit." We stayed in unit 183 with another couple and were amazed at the quality of the interior finishes and luxury beds and the best ocean views from the lanai! The kitchen was beautiful and well appointed - had everything we could have ever hoped for with high end appliances and granite countertops...a comfortable place to cook with friends! and the location of this condo-hotel could not be better! It seriously is in walking distance to EVERYTHING and is right on the beach! What more could you ask for? We loved it and will definitely will go back...can't wait!

Reviews.Title: “Home away from Home!”
Reviews.Author: afmom
Reviews.Content: We had a fabulous time in Maui at the Kaanapali Alii! We needed a condo that had all the amenities of home and this one delivered. Our two bedroom garden view was perfect for beach time, snorkle time (just a short walk to Black Rock), and evening walks to view the sunset. The bedrooms were very comfortable and the kitchen had all that we needed to cook. Best of all, the grills on site next to the pool allowed us to bbq every night. The beachwalk was lovely and provided a great way to stretch our legs after dinner. The pool was relaxing and the beach access (with complimentary chairs) was great. Some of the other hotels along this stretch had a small beach area, but the Kaanapali Alii had a very wide area so you didn't feel cramped. I highly recommend this condo!

Reviews.Title: “Greatest Vacation of my Life!”
Reviews.Author: ericaf10
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to take a trip to Maui for our wedding anniversary, and the Resort surpassed our expectations. Our room was spacious, clean, and with a view. The beach was so incredibly close...it was amazing. We would definitely stay here again and recommend it to anyone interested in a beach front resort with friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Condos......”
Reviews.Author: Pdxgalkel
Reviews.Content: But, if you're a smoker and disabled, don't stay here....they make you go down onto the sand at the beach to smoke, and if you use a walking device of any kind, well, it's not a pretty picture. The condos themselves are very nice, but ours was not like the pictures online. Most all of the units are side views, but still amazing, and the lanais are HUGE! Ours was recently remodeled and had high end kitchen appliances that barely worked...funny huh? And the decor was the ultra modern, chrome mixed with an asian theme...hmmmm...Anyway, the personnel here are all very nice and helpful, and most are always offering a smile and greeting to you when they see you. I would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “MauiCondos.com Property Review. Andrea & Jill Thomas”
Reviews.Author: Andrea_Thomas_Review
Reviews.Content: Jill and I love this place. The location is outstanding and we love the huge rooms. Right on Kaanapali Beach and next to Whalers Village, Dig Me Beach and walking distance to all the hotels on Kaanapali Beach. You are literally 30 steps to the beach. The pool is huge and there is an outdoor jacuzzi. Lots of activities to choose from in this area. The condos are from 1500-1900 sq. feet. Upscale. Deluxe. Finest appointments. The rooms are huge. The staff is wonderful. There is a front desk concierge. Ideal for families or couples. We love staying here. One of our favorite properties on the island. My daughter and I can get upgrades and free nights for our guests.

Reviews.Title: “It was a great time”
Reviews.Author: Michaels202
Reviews.Content: This is the third time we have stayed at the Kaanapali Alii. It is a great place to rest and relax. The new pool is just super. The staff work very hard to make your stay as great as possible, and they are always ready to help with whatever arrangements you need made. It was another super stay in Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for Young Family”
Reviews.Author: Carly32
Reviews.Content: Condo is ideal for young families. The units are so spacious, and the housekeeping does an amazing job keeping them tidy . I can't say enough about the kindness of the staff. Pool renovation is awesome. I walked up and down the beach and the Alli has the best portion of beach on the entire strip.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise in a beautiful oceanfront condo!”
Reviews.Author: SEE1981
Reviews.Content: We were scheduled for a vacation to France due to Iceland volcano, we quickly changed to a Maui trip. This condo was a randon selection and a terrific surprise. The third floor oceanfront 2 bedroom condo has updated and beautifully decorated. The pool was never crowded, well maintained and included a pavilion with two large screen TV so we didn't miss the basketball playoffs while poolside! The pool staff was wonderful, very helpful. Also there was a recently renovated brand new oceanfront 10-stand barbeque area - looked like those fully furnished outdoor kitchens. We did not use those grills but chose to stroll to Whalers Village very close buy that had three terrific restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place for families with young kids”
Reviews.Author: davidsandiego
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week here with a 3 and 5 year old. The new pools are great - very nice and perfect for young kids although there are no slides. Two hot tubs at good temps. 2 big pools and 1 small wading pool. The water temp was a bit random though. The first day the pool temp was around 85 - excellent for the young ones then the rest of the time it was around 78 - just a few degrees warmer than the ocean. Great in the summer, a little cool in April. Tennis courts are lousy - some sort of surface called "classic clay" - basically a carpet like material with and on top. Ball moves slower and you slide like clay but it also takes a ton of bad bounces like a poorly surfaced court. Don't expect to get any quality tennis in (the courts are open all the time though). Health club is very nice - open at 5am and includes everything you need. Good BBQs with supplies on sight. Great location next to some fancy hotels and under 5 minute walk to about 5 places for meals/views/pupus/drinks/etc. It was very windy during our entire stay - spoke to some people who had been there awhile and they said the wind hadn't died down in 3 weeks - so be forewarned. Most days were too windy to really use the beach at all. Beach is nice but even beach in front has clumps of coral 20 feet out. Black rock for snorkeling about 10 min walk. Skip the sunset cliff diving ceremony - not worth it. Luau at Hyatt okay - about 1 hour show but seemed like going thru the Disneyland "it's a small world" continuously as not much changed. Recommend the sunset sails from Kaanapali - Terralini was great for spotting whales - we spotted 9 whales in one hour - were within 50 yards of most. No free WIFI at the Alii either.

Reviews.Title: “Not at all as promised. Staff is in the wrong industry... no aloha spirit.”
Reviews.Author: md150
Reviews.Content: We did not receive the premier view as promised. In general, staff was either downright rude or unconcerned completely with their jobs. They seem to find tourists offensive. (The exception was the housekeeping staff, who were nice.) Noise was more severe than they indicated at booking. The pool issue was as others have noted: Refusal to provide the passes to the other pools, limited hours at some of the other pools if you did manage to get passes, total blase attitude, etc. (The staff at the nearby pools seemed quite amiable, so any of those three neighboring properties would presumably be better places to stay. Some were nice enough to let us in even without the passes and were apparently quite familiar with the Alii's jerk-ish treatment of its guests.) Note: even without the view we paid for, the view was still beautiful... as it was from the other hotels/condos on Kaanapali Beach. So, I'd highly recommend going elsewhere. The beach itself is lovely white sand. Fairly crowded, but that's to be expected.

Reviews.Title: “By far the best stay we have experienced in Kaanapali”
Reviews.Author: fisherontour
Reviews.Content: We booked a 2 bed ocean view premier suite and requested a unit above palm tree height so that we had uninterupted views. We have visited Kaanapali and stayed at several condo resorts previously and this is definitely the best. Great location, within easy walking of restaurants, bars and shops. Beautiful position beach-front with spectacular views across to Lanai. Amazing colourful skies at sunset. Although the furnishings in our suite were a little dated, the rooms were nevertheless very, very comfortable and exceptionally well-maintained. The public areas, environs and gardens are immaculate. This is an expensive resort, but I think it represents good value for a family stay as the suites are spacious and well appointed. The resort has a reassuring ambience of understated luxury and exclusivity. I don't usually award 5 on Tripadvisor unless the resort is both outstanding and entirely unique. The K Alii is outstanding, but has (inferior) competitors nearby, so it is not unique; otherwise I am very tempted to give a score of 5.

Reviews.Title: “Tropical Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Donulee
Reviews.Content: This is a newly remodled resort with beach front rooms. One of the best on the island. We stay in unit 212 and we always enjoy our stays here. We highly recommend this resort with a beach front pathway that walks the entire beach all the way to Whalers Village. The perfect get away for solo travelers, couples, familys, or friends!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT STAY”
Reviews.Author: dlnormedic
Reviews.Content: We recently Jan20th/2010 stayed in a 2brm/2bth garden view. The view was not garden, more parking lot, however the condo made up for the lack of view. Very comfortable beds, and lots of room for a family. The new pool is great, the only downside is it is a bit deep for a five year old who is learning to swim and the wading pool is quite small. I would stay again however and would recommend it to anyone!!

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING place for a PERFECT vacation!”
Reviews.Author: Travelgirl1121
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here on several occasions and have always very much enjoyed the facilities. On this most recent stay we stayed in unit 3114 which was newly remodeled and picturesque. The design and personal touches in this condo made it feel like home. There were several "extras" in the unit, like a margarita machine, ipod speakers in every room, flat screens in every room and fine linens. We also enjoyed that this unit had both ocean and mountain views with almost daily rainbows pearing over the mountains. Couldn't have asked for anything more! The pool construction was almost done during our stay and looks fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “excellent property”
Reviews.Author: Muddog
Reviews.Content: Our group, family with an 8 year old, traveled with a good friend over Christmas/New Years. The property is beautiful. We stayed in room 423 second floor. No view (garden View close to parking lot) but condo is totally re-done and gorgeous. Easy in & out, large comfortable lanai. Everybody was very friendly and helpful, esp. Wendy at the activity bar. Quite a few grills near pool and beach that was a great gathering spot in the evening. The beach is perfect, large and sandy. Pool was new & nice but we spent our time at the beach. This was our 1st time to Maui, but our friend has been many times and was able to show us around. Convenient location near town and grocery store. Nice walking path to see other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: DONSA
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here from 12/4/09 to 12/14/09. A lot of remodeling going on, but we hade a great condo with a view of the ocean and the mountains. We had been told about the pool and area around the pool being redone but had not been told about the remodeling in the hallways and doorways and the check in area. We were without water in our unit when we checked in, but after calling we had water about two hours later. We had a great condo and the staff was also very good and friendly. When we left most of the remodeling was almost done. We had a great stay even with all that was going on. It wll be the #1 place to stay when done.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at the Alii”
Reviews.Author: BobbyVacation
Reviews.Content: I'm the type of vacationer that believes once you've found a gem, you keep coming back to it. I've been to the KA a handful of times and my girlfriend and I caught a great deal to stay at this comfortable condo while they remodeled their pool. Rooms: The rooms are very spacious. Main room had a wrap around couch, tv and a lanai (we had a partial ocean view...pretty nice). They all have a washer/dryer, fridge, dishwasher, etc. Full kitchen and dining room. The rooms are large as well. We stayed in the smaller option for a condo and still had 2 full baths. TIP...before you go grocery shopping, take a look around the condo. Ours already had detergent and drier sheets. Pool: For those that dig their pool time, the KA has worked out a deal for guests to use the pools at the Sheraton (15 minute walk towards black rock), the Westin (next door) or the Marriot (also next door). It appears that the KA pool will be very nice once it is complete. Beach: Great beach. Surf was high when we were there, but normally the waves are fairly small. KA has free beach chairs to use and cabanas for rent. At times, you could hear some of the construction equipment from the beach, but for the most part it's hard to get distracted in paradise. Staff: Very kind and helpful. They do it right. Rooms were always clean, concierge service was good and the guys down by the beach handing out chairs were always eager. Construction: Seemed to me that the Alii was pretty upfront about their construction. They covered all their bases though by arranging for passes to other pools and even setting up grills by the beach (their old grills were near the pool area). You can definitely tell it's going on because there is a perimeter of black tarp around the side of the hotel facing the beach. I hear it will be complete soon, so should not be an issue for future travelers. Weather: Take the weather reports you see on tv and in the Maui Daily News with a grain of salt. They predicted rain every day and it may have rained once at night at the KA. To be sure, it does rain frequently in Hawaii, but something about being on West Maui helped us escape a lot of it on our trip. Crowds: Also found out that early November is a pretty quiet time in Maui. Got the impression from the locals that tourism is down this year...may mean deals are out there if you look hard enough. Do's - Breakfast at Pioneer Inn, Sit upstairs for dinner at Cheeseburger in Paradise with live music, Snorkeling at Black Rock, day trip to Napalii Beach, Sunset on Kaanapali Beach, Driving the Road to Hana. We will be heading back to KA for certain. Enjoy Maui!

Reviews.Title: “Tha Alii Misrepresented Extent of Construction”
Reviews.Author: TnTravel123
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here over Thanksgiving holiday and my young children were awaked every morning at 8 am by tile cutting tools and bobcats/bulldozers which ran all day long (interupting naptime) until after 4pm. Sure-they found it most entertaining. I did not!!! When I booked this hotel, I was told by staff that it was under construction for pool renovation. But, I was assured that by the time we got there in November all that would be left would be landscaping(that sounded ok and quiet). HA!!! What a joke- it looks like a long time before construction will be wrapping up. We were also told we would have several options at near-by pools that we would be able to use(Westin and Marriot) since there pool is under constructon. HA!!! What they failed to inform me is that they only allot a certain number of pool passes a day(and you can't go to the same one each day) and if you do not get there by soon after 7 am- your chance of getting to go to a pool that day is not likey. I did know this place was under a pool renovation. What I am upset about is I feel they misrepresented the extent and noise of this construction. Also, they misrepresented the ability to access alternative pools to use in the area. Yes- our views were stunning and the room was nice. I just wish we could have heard the ocean instead of construction noise all week. I wish I could have read an honest review on this hotel before spending alot of money on a not-so quiet hotel in paradise. I would not recommend this hotel. Even after all this construction business is over (months from now-although I heard from another guest it has already been going on for more than a year-yikes), I would not recommend this hotel b/c of how I feel the staff misrepresented themselves in regard to the construction and pool access.

Reviews.Title: “major construction- limited pool access- stay away !!!”
Reviews.Author: rajk-family
Reviews.Content: please be warned that the Alii is under major construction and it doesnt look like it will be completed for quite sometime. Construction starts around 730am with saws cutting tiles, forklifts,bulldozers,jackhammers,and units/hallways all over being renovated. The Alii mislead us in many ways: construction is 6 days a week starting sometimes around 7am. there are only limited numbers of pool passes for the marriott and westin- many upset families at the front desk at 7am finding out there will be no pool to go to today. many units are being renovated- the unit above ours was having some new flooring put in- every day from 8am until about 5pm- banging continuously. the Alii maids were wonderful and the view from our beachfront unit was impecable. the noise of construction overshadowed the calming waves on the beach. i would highly recommend going to any other resort until the construction is finished- could be a few months off!

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: wewannagoagain
Reviews.Content: I was simply blown away by the 2 bedroom-2 bath condo we had at the Ali'i! It was gorgeous, and the view was amazing from the living room, kitchen, bedroom, and lanai! The condo sported white marble floors, granite countertops and stainless appliances. I have seen pictures of other units at the Ali'i that make this one look rather dull! The pool area is under renovation, with construction beginning at 8am--bulldozers and all! The beach is very nice. The Whaler's Village is 2 doors down on the beachwalk ( which stretches from the Hyatt to the Sheraton). Black Rock is within 5 minutes walking distance. Rooms are not easily accessible from the parking garage, which in itself is a treat with all the reserved spots for condo owners that leave their cars while they are not in residence--so luggage transport is a hassle. It is a quick drive to Lahaina from the Ali'i. Parking is complimentary. Renovations were being done on the hallways while we staying here--painting, scraping wallpaper--but not enough to make it inconvenient. The sunsets were okay, but the island of Lanai blocks seeing the sun actually slip under the horizon. My biggest complaint was the front desk staff. When I arrived, my greeting was, "Welcome to the Kaanapali Ali'i. I need your credit card." That was not a very welcoming introductiont o the property. We were told nothing about any of the ammenities at the property, alternatives to pool access since their pool was shut down, or anything about Whaler's Village. I left the Ali'i missing a lot because of the front desk staff. This condo property is a great alternative to the hotels on this stretch of Kaanapali Beach.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Property/Great Location”
Reviews.Author: AKChiropractor
Reviews.Content: My husband and his staff celebrated achieving a significant business goal with a trip to paradise. Kay Ryan (www.mauikay.com) helped us book two condos to accommodate our party of 9. We wanted a beautiful property within walking distance of a variety of activities. Maui Kay recommended The Kaanapalli Alii, which turned out to be the perfect spot. There are great restaurants and lounges; very good swimming, snorkeling and boogie board beaches; and a wonderful shopping center--all without the need to drive. The condos themselves (Kay helped us book a premium condo) are fantastic. They're incredibly spacious and beautiful. The view from our premium Ocean View condo was spectacular. The only downsides were the fitness center (my husband felt the equipment was pretty old and dated) and the fact that the pool isn't as extravagant as some of the nearby resorts. All in all, it was truly a trip to paradise!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Kaanapali Alii”
Reviews.Author: BasketballFan44
Reviews.Content: My family just returned from the Kaanapali Alii. We were a bit concerned about the construction but I did receive a letter before we arrived letting us know that the cost for the room would be lowered so we figured weâ€™d give it a shot. Actually the construction was not that bad and as it was our first trip to Maui we spend most of our time touring the island or doing activities and when we returned the working was done for the day. The pool area is what they are working on so when we wanted to go swimming we either went to the beach or went to the front desk where they provided us pool passes for either the Westin, Marriott or Sheraton. One thing I want to let everyone in on is that each day the front desk assigns guests a different pool pass so you go to a different pool each day, to be honest it was kind of fun to be able to swim in all those pools and worked great for our family. All in all our vacation was a great success the staff was friendly and helpful and for what we paid I have no complaints. We look forward to returning again and canâ€™t wait to see how everything turns out.

Reviews.Title: “Great beach and location; Disappointing service and staff.”
Reviews.Author: bekc
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Kaanapali Alli in early August 2009 with 2 teenagers. Having booked the room and requested a 2 bedroom premier with a den months before (and told it was highly likely we would get such a room), I was disappointed when upon check-in it was not available. The lady at the counter said there were actually very few such rooms and generally dismissed any disappointment I expressed. She was fairly rude. I also witnessed the same general disregard when another family checked in and were disappointed to not be oceanfront after they had requested it. If we would have know a den was not likely, we would have focused our hotel search more heavily on other properties. Our room was a pretty nice 2 bedroom with a view of the ocean but not the famous Kaanapali beach sunets. We were in building 1 which faced too far south to get the sunset view. You would be better off in building 3 or 4. The location of the hotel is great. It is between the Westin and the Hyatt and offers a great beach for swimming and surfing. The pool and grounds were adequate; however, the pool staff were far from friendly and downright hovered to collect beach chairs and towels at the end of the day. If you stood up and walked away for a couple of minutes, your towel was snatched up. When you requested a towel from the desk, you were made to feel as if you were being too demanding. Entering the grounds after exiting the beach you felt as if a bouncer was checking you out and might ID you. Some basic friendliness and courtesy by the staff would be a great improvement to the pool/beach experience at the Alii! Overall, our stay was acceptable thanks to the location of the hotel, but given the price we paid for our 2 bedroom, I would probably stay somewhere else next time. I would go for a better pool and friendlier staff. Probably the Sheraton or Westin.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Brodes5
Reviews.Content: This is our third trip to the Alii in the past seven years. My husband and I always travel with our three teenage children (19, 17 & 14) and my 74 year old mother. We have stayed on the first floor ocean front condo in building 1 the first year and then on an ocean front condo on the tenth floor another year. I have learned that you need to specificially ask for a "premier" room to get an upgraded place. This year we stayed in 316, right on the ground floor facing the ocean. The most spectacular place we have stayed yet. Having windows all around to see the georgous ocean any time was just wonderful. The housekeeping staff do a wonderful job keeping everything clean and tidy. My daughter and I spent a lot of time at the pool and we only had a brief time when kids were throwing a small ball back and forth. They really should have stopped because it was clearly posted not to throw any balls. The property is planning to start their remodeling of the pool area in a couple days and are offering special rates during that time period. I absolutely love staying at the Alii and plan on going back again. This time it may just be my husband and myself so we can stay in a smaller place. I absolutely recommend this property.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxed Environment & Pure Heaven”
Reviews.Author: SPisces
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our trip to Maui. We had eight family members, including young children. We stayed in two oceanfront condos.Originally we had booked with the understanding of getting two condos next to each other since this was a "family" vacation. However, when we arrived, we were told they didn't have any units available next to one another nor do they guarantee condo arrangements. We were very disapointed and felt the woman at the front desk was really just telling us white lies. She went on to tell us that their were only six condos that were being rented out as all the others were not (Four towers of condos). We decided to go have a drink and eat since we had been flying all day.......later we returned to speak with someone new at the desk and were able to make a room adjustment. We still were not able to have rooms close to one another.....but the rest of the stay was wonderful. Too bad we started off wasting time trying to work things out with the staff, it ended up taking several hours to get them to switch one of the rooms and move our luggage. Beautiful place, friendly guests and be sure to have the kids take advantage of the Kids Club Activities.

Reviews.Title: “We Didn't Want to Leave!”
Reviews.Author: WWK
Reviews.Content: I was feeling a bit skeptical when the front desk told us, "Wait until you see your apartment. It's a real "WOW!", but , they were absolutely right. When we walked into our unit (#136) we were greeted by a magnificent, newly renovated apartment that looked like it must have been featured in some major design magazine. And then there was the view of Kaanapali Beach stretched out in front of us just beyond the enormous dining room and living room windows. OK. I'll say it. WOW. For less than the price of two oceanfront rooms at The Sheraton Maui, we had a luxury apartment, complete with a gorgeous kitchen, dining room, three TVS ( two flat screens), and very comfortable bedrooms and AC. The beach in front of the apartments is really beautiful, and draws a lot of surfers and boarders. We found it a lot less crowded and more fun than the beach in front of the Sheraton Maui, although the Sheraton's portion of the beach is great for snorkeling. The only slight complaint I can even think to make about Kaanapali Alii is that the pool seemed awfully small for a property of this size, and can be overrun with small kids. But with one of the most beautiful beaches we've ever seen just out front, who cares?!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: LineS
Reviews.Content: We traveled straight through from CT to Maui which took 18 hours total. By the time we arrived at the Kaanapali Alii it was 10 pm Maui time and 4 am to us. We drove up and Chris greeted us by name at the car as if we were family and sent us in to check in while he unloaded our car and parked it. At check in they informed us we had been upgraded to a premium oceanview room (I had booked oceanview). Chris walked us and our luggage up to our condo, pausing along the way to point out things on the property such as the pool house, etc. (He even asked if we were hungry and if he could get us something to eat) He really set a great tone for our entire vacation. We then arrived in our absolutely beautiful and HUGE condo (number 265). Granite, tumbled marble, stainless steel, brushed nickel, new carpeting, comfy beds. In the morning we saw the ocean from the living area and second bedroom and mountains from master bedroom and kitchen. It was absolutely the most beautiful, quiet, and relaxing place I have ever stayed in. All of the staff was wonderful. We had a couple of small maintenance issues (running toilet, broken thermostat) and they were there within minutes to fix them. The location is great as it is between the Westin and the Marriott and it's easy to use their amenities, you can even sign them to your room. The property at the Alii is small and pretty and quiet. Pool is not great but there is an overhaul planned for that in the near future. Beach is gorgeous and not as crowded as other spots along the resort strip. We were so sad to leave. If we ever make it back to Maui, we will definately stay at the Alii again.

Reviews.Title: “Total perfection in paradise.”
Reviews.Author: Tigeralum
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our first trip to Hawaii and I am still dreaming about it. Our huge 2BR mtn view room on the fifth floor was perfect for a family of 5 - 2 teens (3 TVs!), private and quiet. Liked the pool and LOVED the beach. Drove to nearby beaches for snorkeling. LOVED the grills, friendly people and lack of fighting for pool lounges. I would definitely return in a heartbeat. CLose to Lahaina and grocery stores. I will take this over a resort any day!

Reviews.Title: “We will be staying at Kaanapali Alii in August/09.”
Reviews.Author: frazzledmomof2
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews and looking at some pictures I'm happy with our decision to stay here. I was just wondering from others who have stayed here recently if there is a difference between their Premier rooms or not. I didn't realize until after we booked that each room is individually owned and some pictures depict gorgeous remodeled rooms and some are a little more dated but nice just the same. I booked directly through their site and found the reservation representatives extremely helpful. It was recommended by the representative to stay in either building 1 or 3 on one of the higher floors since we will be staying in a one bedroom ocean view premier room. Just want to make sure that all the money we spent to stay here is well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, comfortable, great service!”
Reviews.Author: ErinSF82
Reviews.Content: Long story short, I love this hotel. Kaanapali is not my favorite beach on Hawaii due to overcrowding, but this hotel is far enough from Whaler Village that it has a bit more privacy. Also, being one of the smaller hotels on that beach, it's possible to get pool chairs and use the fantastic BBQs! I've stayed here twice, and is the only hotel on Kaanapali that I would recommend whole-heartedly.

Reviews.Title: “We love it here, BUT”
Reviews.Author: CAEon
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at the Alii since it opened - 25+ years ago. We love it there. However, I have to agree with one of the negative comments - that is that the rules have been gradually relaxed over the years. We find that we can no longer use the hot tub as it is usually filled with underage kids and the staff tolerates this though it is against the rules and signs are posted with an age limit. They do not enforce the restrictions. Otherwise, we have always found the staff to be more than helpful especially the front desk, and security guards. All are friendly, polite and more than willing to provide whatever is needed for your comfort. I agree some of the rooms are becoming rather unkempt. and in need of a remodel, but you get what you pay for. The property itself is wonderful and the setting great ( long, beautiful beach for walking and shopping ).. It is an older property so one must tolerate some water shut offs, etc. for repairs. However, it would be nice to be informed before making a reservation. Regarding Brian, one of the pool staff - he has never been anything but helpful and polite. However, we have seen unruly and undisciplined children around the pool whose parents have not taught them any manners. I expect this might have been the case in one of the reviews I read complaining about Brian. If anything, we have sometimes found the pool staff to be a little too tolerant of ill mannered adults who disrespect the rules (bringing beer bottles in, and undisciplined children throwing balls and other objects around (also against the rules) in the pool area. The pool and office staff is ALWAYS friendly and helpful, many times going above and beyond expectations in making sure you enjoy your stay. We have grown to love many of the people there as though they are family - including Glenda, Ron, Dean, Kurt, Manny, Brian, Sheldon, and Dan. In recent years a change in management has not lived up to the Alii motto of Alii No ka Oi, but we are willing to tolerate it because of the wonderful people who work there and who try their best to insure you enjoy your stay. (roughly translated - Nothing finer - the best!)

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms with a view! The best yet.”
Reviews.Author: NancyBSt_Paul_MN
Reviews.Content: We chose the Kaanapali Alii and booked it through Maui Beachfront Rentals. In comparing the price we paid for the week, I believe we saved well over $1,000 instead of booking directly through the hotel. We received two free nights paying $500/night for the other five and it was well worth it. We have traveled extensively and have rarely felt that paying extra for ocean view was really worth it. It was here! Our view was superb from our 10th floor, large 2 bedroom, 2 bath. The lanai is huge and easily could accommodate the five of us. We watched whales as well as sunsets from the lanai. The Alii is on the best stretch of Kaanapali Beach. We walked to several of the many restaurants and bars along the beautiful beachfront walk. The grounds are beautiful, the barbeque area is really nice and cleaned thoroughly every night. The pool area is slated to undergo a complete overhaul in the fall. It is a rather nondescript pool, but there are plenty of lounge chairs, towels, and other pool/beach amenities. It is a relaxing setting...not a lot of action or crowds as in neighboring hotel pool areas. This stretch of beach is beautiful with many activities available and the Alii is a wonderful place to stay and to enjoy them.

Reviews.Title: “Kaanapali Alii”
Reviews.Author: nytraveldef
Reviews.Content: we spent 15 wonderful days at the Ka'anapali Ali'i in unit 233. A 2 bdrm premier ocean view condo. I can't say enough about the Ali'i. The condo was beautiful and perfect for our varied vacation, the first week we spent with our dear friends from California and the 2nd week was spent with our 21 year old son and 3 of his college roomates. There was plenty of room for all and even though the weather was not always the best, we all had a great time. The staff at the Ali'i was nothing short of wonderful in all aspects, Glenda at the front desk was more than helpful, check in was so smooth and we were even able to get a late check out which was so helpful. John at the bell desk was also great. We spent many beautiful afer dinner evenings on the lanai, watched the whales jumping every morning, had great happy hours at the hula grill's barefoot bar with Peter and Gayle, they also serve a mean goat cheese pizza for lunch and a wonderful Macadamia Nut crusted Mahi Mahi for dinner. We also ate at Pacifico and Lahaina grill in town, both places I would highly recommend. Ruth Chris also great but pricey, and I am from NY so I mean pricey, Sonz at the Hyatt was good food and attmosphere too. I can't wait to start planning for next year, maybe 3 weeks.

Reviews.Title: “Just another perspective”
Reviews.Author: TexasMaui_lover
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have read with interest some of the more recent reviews of the Alii when guests have commented negatively about rule enforcement, especially as it concerns the pool. We felt compelled to offer a different perspective. We have stayed at the Alii more than 10 times and, with each visit, grew increasingly more uncomfortable as kids (or even aggressive adults) took over the property. Signs around the pool indicating no jumping or no running were constantly being ignored and the staff seemed unwilling or oblivious to step forward and enforce their own rules. The pool is not large yet kids and their parents would think nothing of throwing balls back and forth in the pool or watching as they hit the pool deck and wait (or ask) for others to throw their balls back in (ballplaying in the pool is "supposedly" prohibited). The hot tub is another example. When we first started visiting the Alii, the rule was that no one under the age of 13 (?) was allowed in the tub. Slowly the rule was relaxed and eventually it seemed like even the smallest of children (frequently unsupervised and often wearing diapers) were frequenting the hot tub area. Eventually, we decided that while the property and location are lovely, the lack of enforcement of rules and the lack of cooperation on the part of many of the guests meant that we should look for other accommodations--which we did. In doing so, however, we let the management know why we felt that we could no longer return to the Alii. The bottom line--we applaud the efforts of the management to enforce the rules and encourage them to keep up the good work. We'll be visiting Maui again in a couple of weeks and will stop by to see for ourselves how things look--who knows--maybe we'll be able to return again to the Alii in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Alii, do some upgrades!”
Reviews.Author: debbieinSeattle
Reviews.Content: We have going to Maui for 15 years and have only stayed at the Kaanapali Alii. For the past 3-4 trips, have been unhappy with the quality of the rooms. Our fault, we chose not to pay the 'premium' room prices and stay in the 'standard' rooms. The difference? Premium rooms are not updated/upgraded. This trip, we were in room 111 and found it disgusting! Having gone to the Alii for so long, we were aware that the owner has never put a dime in this unit, it is all original work when the Alii first opened. The stove had rust on the bottom drawer, the washer/dryer sounded as if they would come through the unit after us and worked so poorly that the detergent didn't rinse out of our darks, so we had 'streaks' on our clothes. The microwave was terrible, to cook frozen vegetables, it was double the time and still not completely done. Forget popcorn in the microwave! The dishwasher never did get the dishes clean. In the bathrooms, the caulk was either cracked,missing or had mold on it. We just didn't feel 'clean' in this unit. We had put towels from the pool area down on the sofa and chair. To the staff's credit, I went to the front desk to ask to see a premium room and mentioned to Glenda we needed to see the difference and mentioned our concerns. She showed us the higher priced room and what a difference! To the Alii's credit, we were given our $$ back for one night's stay, which was not really necessary. It was our choice to stay in a standard room vs a premium. I did ask Glenda about 'standards' the Alii has and she said, yes, room 111 is one of the last units to be rented out (no wonder we could get a room in September for the Christmas holiday at the Alii and only had to stay 7 nights instead of the mandatory 10). Glenda did tell me that each comment card a guest fills out, the general manager copies and forwards to the owner. The owner of unit 111 is very much aware of the negativity concerning this unit and still chooses not to do any updates. We love the Alii, the location, spaciousness of the units, the staff, but have come to the conclusion we either need to pay the add'l $1,000+ for a weeks stay to be more comfortable or go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “not great”
Reviews.Author: snowbird84078
Reviews.Content: Alii has some nice condos. Our unit was updated and generally pretty nice. This place seems to have some customer service problems. The staff did not seem to like the guests and acted punitive about things like towell checkout and enforcing pool rules. Also, since posting here, A couple that we travelled with received several messages from Alii staff regarding their review of the hotel. the Alii staff apparently follow these reveiws closely and I suspect they author a few as well. Our stay was generally good. The Alii has a pool that is ok at best. the pool would be more fun for families if the alii staff relaxed some of their rules. they have excessive signage posted surrounding the pool that say no jumping, horseplay, splashing, etc... if they do not want kids at the hotel, they should just say so. Please do not act as though you welcome families and then try to restrict them from using the facilities. I would not recommend this hotel for families. I would choose the marriot or Hyatt instead.

Reviews.Title: “Well appointed condos in great location”
Reviews.Author: cgbroderick
Reviews.Content: If you want a condo instead of a hotel in Kaanapali, this is a great choice. The condos are big and elegantly appointed by owners and property managment. Location cannot be beat right on the beach between the Westin and Hyatt Regency. Lots to do in both directions. Rates are high, but you can find some deals. We stayed four nights and got fifth night free. It was still expensive -- about the same as staying in one of the upscale hotels in the area, but of course you save a lot on food and have a lot more space. We have three kids so space is important and eating out every night is prohibitive. Pool is small. If that's important to you, you will be disappointed. The beach is terrific right outside your front door. Swimming in the ocean every day under a warm sun is why we come to Hawaii. Service is fine for what it is -- it's not hotel service. All of us had an enjoyable five-day stay.

Reviews.Title: “alii not good for kids”
Reviews.Author: chrisfromdenver
Reviews.Content: our one bedroom unit 433 was nice. recently remodelled with nice furnishings...as expected for the price. there was a constant source of noise during the day. groundskeepers using chainsaws liberally, remodeling of nearby units with saws, drilling and hammering all day every day. The internet is total BS at $12/day or $50/week - and does not support outlook or other email clients or VPN. Crappy hotels everywhere offer free wireless. pay for a nice place and they nickle and dime you for reduced service. the pool is very lackluster compared to the Hyatt and Marriot which are both comparable cost. also the Alii does not have any ammenities such as restaurant or even a bar. I did not come to maui to eat meals at the hotel restaurant, but it would be nice to order a drink on the beach or at the hotel pool. the pool is apparently designated only for old people. we were surprised to see the incredible list of rules. for instance, no horseplay, no jumping, no splashing, no playing ball, etc... they are also strictly enforced by an entire staff of ogres that hate children. our children are not obscene or unusual in any way. these people genuinely do not like kids and do not want them around or having fun. also, the concierge recommended a really expensive and super crappy luau (Hyatt - Drums of the Pacific).

Reviews.Title: “Great choice”
Reviews.Author: sharealoha
Reviews.Content: Rented our 2 bedroom apartment directly from the owners. Excellent decor, quality,clean. Huge apartment on the main floor. No view but who cares, you are not in your room in the day. Highly reccomend. Shopping and restaurants nearby. BBQs for your use. Small pool, never in it. Great snorkelling at Black Rock,walking distance. Stayed in Maui several times before,would rec. Good location, close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Best Fun I've Ever Had!”
Reviews.Author: Kaanapali
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a friend and it was amazing! I loved this place. I felt almost like I was in my own home, only better. The Alii is so comfortable, and very luxurious. The staff are super friendly, and the being directly on the beach cannot be beat. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “What a view!”
Reviews.Author: Love2Travel59701
Reviews.Content: What a great vacation! We've been to Maui many times and this is the second time we've stayed at the Alii. It is a PERFECT location and a PERFECT beach. We stayed in unit #3103, a two bedroom / two bath with an ocean view. We were travelling with another couple and it was a perfect arrangement. The bedrooms are separated by the living area (living room, kitchen and dining room) so we had plenty of privacy. The master bedroom and bath were slightly larger than the guest bedroom. However, the guest bedroom had a lanai. Advantages for both. Each unit in the Alii are independently owned. Thus they are all uniquely decorated and furnished. This unit definitely needs some updating. The kitchen was large and well-equiped. However it could use some remodelling. The living room furniture was very clean, but again could use a bit of redecorating. We were willing to overlook the dated unit because the view from this unit is so amazing!! It was wonderful to wake each morning to the view of Black Rock, Molokau, Lanai and Kaanapali Beach! Pure Heaven. You absolutely cannot go wrong with this property. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Trip08192008
Reviews.Content: We spent five days at the Kaanapali Alii and it was the perfect accomodation for a family of 5. Our condo was clean and spacious, the view was spectacular and the staff very helpful. The location was perfect, close to the Whalers Village and right in the middle of the most beautiful stretch of beach in Maui. We would highly recommend the Kaanapali Alii. It was very relaxing to have breakfast on the balcony each morning. The kids (18,21,23) spent their days surfing, we could walk along the beautiful walkways to Black Rock and a short walk to the Whalers Village for dinner and drinks was wonderful. The pool was small but the ocean is so warm and beautiful, the kids had surf boards which they rented and I had a float that I could just relax in the ocean all day and watch them, I just didn't want to get out. We went to Front Street for dinner a couple of nights and it was great fun, we had dinner watched the amazing sunsets, shopped and had drinks, lots of restaurants and bars to choose from. After our time at the Kaanapali Alii we flew to Honolulu for a week on the Pride of America, this was a great opportunity to see several other islands. We would deffinately return to Maui and stay at the Kaanapali Alii.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Alii after 5 days in a hotel room”
Reviews.Author: TravelWiseSanDiego
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 10 days on Kaanapali Beach. 5 days at the Westin and 5 days at the Alii with kids 11 and 7. Loved the Westin, great hotel with fun pool but just a single room with 2 double beds. 5 days was enough with 2 kids! We booked the Alii for second 5 days and totally enjoyed the space, luxury and kitchen. Home from home! Booked a two bedroom, partial ocean view room. Slight disappointment at first because we were given beautiful room on 1st floor of building #2 with no ocean view at all (at least not that I could see)! Went back to office and made a fuss and were told that ocean view includes rooms on floors 1 through 11. Problem is that any view from 1st floor would be obscured by (admittedly beautuful) landscaping. I felt that partial ocean view should at least include some peep at the ocean. We were given keys to a room in building #4 which we trooped over to only to find that there was construction going on in that building (drilling etc.). Back to the office and some debate before being offered another room on 3rd floor of building #2 directly above room originally offered on 1st floor. Terriffic, great decor, upscale kitchen, some ocean view etc. etc. Moral of the story - arrive early while there are still options and be prepared to haggle a little until you get what you paid for. After eating out for the first 5 days while at the Westin we were glad to be able to cook for ourselves when we wanted to. Snorkled twice (with Triolgy - great), Rode hourses (Ironwood Ranch - beautiful), Parasailed (with UFO - exhilarating). Spent quite some time in the ocean, directly outside the Alii and in the pool (a little quiet for the kids but at least you could get a chair in the shade). Staff at the Alii were pretty good, and room and grounds excellent. We would stay again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Alii is the Best!”
Reviews.Author: meatwood
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from a week-long stay at the Alii and wish we were still in Maui! Check in was easy; the staff took care of everything, from parking our car to bringing all of our luggage to the room. The front desk staff was always pleasant and helpful. We had booked a 1 bedroom Ocean View room through a travel agent. As there is a lot of construction at the Marriott (South side of the Alii), I had requested an Inter-Court room which overlooks the pool/ocean, which was great. Although the unit had the original decor, everything was in good working condition and was quite comfortable. Unlike the hotel resorts on Kaanapali Beach, the Alii never felt crowded; there were always lounge chairs available at the pool, never had to wait long for an elevator, and usually found a good parking spot. In Tower II (where we stayed) there were just 6 units per floor, so the combination of fewer units than a comparable hotel resort and guests more likely to spend time in their condo units than a hotel room made for a very relaxing environment. We would love to visit the Alii again, but will likely opt for a Premier unit (upgraded kitchen, bath, etc.) next time.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Alii and Maui”
Reviews.Author: ascAustralia
Reviews.Content: We loved the Alii. Friends from Australia recommended the property to us. We rang and thanked them when we arrived. Our family 2 adults 3 children wanted self contained accommodation and some space to have a real holiday. When we made a reservation we had booked an Oceanview premier 2 bedroom unit and requested a high floor. The first unit we were given overlooked the construction site at the Marriot and you could see the ocean if you went onto the balcony and stretched your head around the corner! Of course we loudly complained!! We had just spent over 18 hours travelling so we were a bit disappointed. They then moved us to another unit on the 8th floor overlooking the pool in the middle of the complex and this unit was fabulous. It was huge and it gave us all the space we needed to relax. The location of the Alii is fabulous and we had a great holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings”
Reviews.Author: Lovz2Travel
Reviews.Content: We have been coming to this condominium property for a decade. We got a different condo witch was beautiful and the maid Trinidad was excellent. The bellmen Chris was helpful. The small gym was pleasant enough. Kurt, the pool man was pleasant. However, to things really got to me. Hence, the two star rating. First, I contacted the concierge five different times and on four of those times they gave me wrong information. My biggest complaint is about the pool man Bryan. Bryan yelled at my children and yelled at other couples on the beach that if he had to go pick up their towels he would charge them $25 a towel. RIDICULOUS! They won't even set up your towels, but now they make you take them back! My children told Bryan how in previous years they would take them back to the pool area. He yelled at them and said "The Alii is not luxurious and has no amenities. all we do is rent condos. If you do not like this, stay some where else." Yelling this statement to children and the elderly is completely uncalled for. It appalled me so much for an adult to behave this way and use such an angry tone. In addition, the Alii welcomes guests of low profiles. They pick fights and call other guests names in the pool. The staff does not do anything about it.

Reviews.Title: “We were expecting more”
Reviews.Author: mamatotwo
Reviews.Content: My husband and two kids (ages 4 and 2) stayed at the Alli from April 25th-30th. We booked a 2bd unit that overlooked the pool and ocean. We were expecting something a little nicer decor-wise but the dated furniture and TV were acceptable. We enjoyed breakfast and lunch everyday on our balcony (lanai) while watching the surfers try to catch a wave. We loved the spaciousness of our unit. We had about 1900sq ft and, with 2 kids, we used it all! The kids slept in one bedroom and they took over the den as their playroom. The in-room laundry was used everyday-so nice that they provided detergent. The housekeeping staff was very good and provided us with regular towels and tidied up the place. The only real complaint I had was with the water being shut off on our second to last day there because of some emergency. Thank goodness we left on a snorkel trip early that morning but when we came back we found a note that the water had been shut off all day. We called the front desk and they told us that we could shower in a couple of rooms they were holding over at the Westin or Marriott and that there were port o potties located outside each building. Ha! We have 2 young potty trained kids and are not going to go all the way downstairs and outside to use the potty EVERY time they have to go! The management also delivered two 5 gallon water tanks to use for drinking only. We used it for more than that. We ended up spending our evening over at the Westin-we all showered (much better water pressure in the bath than our drip drip shower at the Alli) and then ate at Ono restaurant and then fed the flamingos and fish and listened to music with the kids. Good thing the water was turned on the next morning. Another small complaint was all the construction, window washing, tree trimming that was going on while we were there. I know it has to be done but it was kind of disruptive especially the tree trimming in the front lobby. We were blocked in the parking structure by a bulldozer of some sort and had to wait while they backed up and then we had to park in the other parking structure's entrance while my husband checked out. It was a loud mess in the front of the hotel. Not a big deal normally but we were trying to check out quickly and get on the road to the airport. Overall, we had a nice stay but next time we will check out suites at the Marriott or the Westin (which is beautiful!). You cannot beat the location and the beaches!

Reviews.Title: “Alii is the BEST on Maui”
Reviews.Author: ABQ_Irish
Reviews.Content: If you like noisy, crowed, cramped, overpopulated hotels, the Alii is NOT for you. This is the second year that my wife and 3 teen boys stayed at the Alii and it was AWESOME. Large, modern, and quiet rooms, excellent staff, and the best beach on Maui. Personal cabanas, quiet pool area, BBQ your dinner on the spectacular grills,or walk to the 20 restaurants nearby. Large, spacious rooms with full kitchens help you to avioid the $25 per person breakfasts at like the adjacent hotels. Watch the poor guest at the adjacent chain hotels stare with envy as they admire the Alli grounds and amenities. The Alii will show you how the rich and famous vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Not All Units Have a Den!!”
Reviews.Author: ColumbusTraveler57
Reviews.Content: We booked a two bedroom oceanfront premier unit for the week of March 15, 2008. There were two adults and 4 "kids" between 17 and 24 from two families. I thought by booking the most expensive unit, I would have the best unit. It does not work that way. From all of the reviews, I expected a unit with 2 bedrooms and a den with a foldout couch or bed. When we arrived, we were told that the oceanfront units DO NOT HAVE DENS, and the couch in the living room was not a foldout, so we ended up with people sleeping on the couch and an uncomfortable rollaway in the middle of the living room. The situation was not ideal. I left a message for the manager on day 2 that was never returned. The other worst aspect was the lack of noise insulation or privacy. For some reason, probably moisture control, all of the doors to the bathrooms are louvered and very thin. We could hear everything that everyone did in the bathroom. There was a lot of wasted space in the units (enormous entry hall on a big L). I would have prefered the den that I expected. (I was told by the front desk that fewer than 5% of the units have dens, which is odd, since almost everyone that reviews these units raves about the extra den/bedroom.) Groceries are very expensive ($8 a gallon for milk, $4.50 a dozen for eggs, $8.00 for a small box of cereal, $6.50 for a 12 pack of sprite cans). We concluded that by the time you buy the stuff to go with a meal, like A1 ($7.00), salad dressing, etc., it was cheaper to go out to eat. We really liked breakfast at CJ Deli and Diner (a mile away - turn left as you get on the highway), and China Bowl in the same mall. We also liked Penne Pasta in Lehaina, also inexpensive, and Kobe Japanese Steakhouse. We grilled a few meals at the highly touted gas grills, but if I went back, I would cook less, if at all, and probably stay at the Westin, Marriott or Hyatt in Kaanapali, with much better pools. The premier oceanfront unit was more than $1000 a night. I could have had two hotel rooms and more service and privacy. The kitchen was well stocked and even had some spices. The pool area was clean but crowded. If you have time, take the Pacific Whale Foundation whale watch. It was wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Maui”
Reviews.Author: MIfly
Reviews.Content: This was our 6th trip to Maui. In past years we stayed at the Hyatt. We decided to try a condo this trip, as we travel with another couple and wanted a little more freedom with meals, etc. We were familiar with the Kaanapali beach area and investigated the Ali'i and decided to try it. I was a little apprehensive, wondering how it could compare to the Hyatt. I cannot convey how wonderful the experience was. We stayed 2 weeks in unit 223. This unit is rented out by Maui Beachfront Rentals but still included the fabulous amenities available to all condos on the property. The condo itself was in a good location, had a lovely view of the grounds and ocean from the lanai. The decor is dated but clean. We really didn't mind that as we come to hawaii for the beauty of the islands, not the decor of the condo! Everything we needed was available for us at the condo, the staff is incredibly friendly, the grounds lovely, and the pool is warm. The beach at the Ali"i is actually much better than in front of the Hyatt and we took full advantage of that fact. We have already booked our return trip for 2 weeks next year!

Reviews.Title: “Condo living at its best”
Reviews.Author: travelgalpdx
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay here. Having never stayed in a condo for vacation before, I didn't know what to expect. When we pulled up to the property, 2 gentlemen came over. One parked the car while the other loaded our luggage on a cart. After a speedy and friendly check in we were shown to our room. Not only did they take care of the luggage, they showed us around the room. We were given a 2 bedroom/bath condo corner unit. The room was spectacular. We had a washer and dryer which was great. There were 3 tvs. One in the living room and one in each bedroom. The master bathroom was gorgeous. The shower was absolutely huge and the lighting was perfect for a bathroom. The kitchen had stainless steel appliances and gorgeous counter tops. I loved the private lanai. The pool was nice and heated. Unfortunately when the weather sucked the whole time so my time at the pool and hot tub was limited. I only have a few minor complaints.....one is there was an odd musty smell. I think it may have came from the couch. The other being the bed in the master bedroom was hard. Not horrible but enough for me to remember. The decor was nice for the most part, but the couch was outdated. This was a wonderful visit, but I do prefer Wailea so I will probably stay in that area next time.

Reviews.Title: “What a special place to visit!”
Reviews.Author: Vacationperson
Reviews.Content: Wonderful, breath taking! Great place, the best, we have ever stayed at. Had a one bedroom unit (#455) that had been totally updated and refurnished. Great place to relax. Very clean and the people on site were fantastic, informing us of places to go, where to eat. Our unit had a fully furnished kitchen. We could eat in the condo or go out to the near by restaurants on the beach. Great food just a short walk down the beach.. The Alii even has gas grills located adjacent to the pool, next to the beach with tables and chairs. Cook your own steak and watch the sunset as you eat. Would we return? In a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Construction Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: travelers6
Reviews.Content: We just returned from nine days at the Kaanapali Alii, and are glad to be home to some peace and quiet. Although this is a gorgeous resort in beautiful Maui, our stay was anything but relaxing. First of all, there is only one working elevator at the resort for each set of two buildings. We were told that this will be the case for at least the next five months while they are upgrading the elevators. This made going up and down a sometimes lengthy event. In fact, some members of our family resorted to the stairs even though we were on the 8th floor. On day one, we were informed that there would be loud construction noise in the building between 10 and 2 Tuesdays-Thursdays due to work on one of the units (think jackhammer). On day two we were awakened at 8 AM by constant beeping and construction noise from the just-begun construction at the Marriott next door. This continued on all weekdays from 8 AM to 5 PM. On day seven we were awakened at 5:30 AM to the sound of lots of feet and moving above us. It turned out that they were moving all furniture from the unit above us to begin construction there. By later that day, the noise level from the construction (gutting the place) above was so loud in our unit, that it was impossible to be there. Also, small pieces of ceiling were falling from the vibrations. Did I mention that water started coming in through the bathroom ceiling? Thankfully, we called the front desk and they took care of it. The noise from above continued for the rest of the stay. Additionally, we received notice that there would be no water in the building for one of the upcoming days since they had to turn it off for construction. I spoke to the manager at the Alii and was told that owners can renovate whenever they like. The Alii is not given specific dates for each unit renovation, and therefore, it is impossible to predict which units will be affected by the noise. If you are looking for a quiet place to enjoy the beauty of Maui, the Kaanapali Alii is not it! Do go to Maui, because it is an amazing place, but find somewhere else to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Condo - perfect location”
Reviews.Author: lovetravel4
Reviews.Content: I used all the reveiws on Tripadvisor to book our trip, so I thought it only fair to write a review upon our return. We were VERY happy with our stay at the Alii. The 2 bedroom premium unit was wonderful. TONS of space - the 2 bedroom was perfect for us and our 2 boys. The kitchen worked out great -being able to make our own breakfast and lunch was a great savings. The staff was VERY helpful - gave us directions to a less busy food store - Star markets, and recommended a great Pizza place for delivery - Vinny's. The pool was fine - and the grilling area, although we didn't use it was very nice - and they scrubbed them clean every morning!! The location was perfect - being able to walk to Whalers Village for dinner/drinks on the water was so convenient and relaxing. I would highly recommend this place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay at the Alii”
Reviews.Author: BeachPrincess_7
Reviews.Content: This condo was great! My family had so much fun here. Our room was really nice and spacious. The beach was wonderful, and the waves were perfect for boogie boarding. The condo is right on the long, white sand beach. The pool was a little small, but still nice. It's convenient that you get to use some services from nearby hotels. The nearby town of Lahaina had a ton of shops and good restaurants. Whalers Village is an outdoor mall that's a short walk away from the Alii. The food court there has good food for much cheaper prices than other restaurants. Overall, I highly recommend the Kaanapali Alii because of its luxurious units and awesome beach. Come here and spoil yourself!

Reviews.Title: “Alii is Awesome”
Reviews.Author: dianedisney
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week at the Alii and thought it was awesome. We were there from July 3-10 and had unit 314, a ground level 2 bedroom that was fantastic. The master had a king bed and the 2nd bedroom had 2 queens and the loft off of the family room had an additional queen bed. We had 5 in our family and kids each had their own beds and plenty of space. We had 16 for dinner one evening with extended family staying in Napili and 10+ for lunch several times as well. We were able to entertain and have plenty of room for everyone. The kitchen was nicely upgraded with granite countertops and did I mention how much room there was??? We had daily maid service and she did an excellent job of keeping up the kitchen and floors, making the beds and replacing the linens. Boy, did I LOVE the daily maid service, on a place this large, without the help, I know that I would have had to spend much more of my vacation time keeping the place picked up. The pool is small but the padded lounge chairs and terry cloth covers make up for it a bit. They do not open the pool until 8 am which mean that people are not running down in the wee hours of the morning trying to reserve a space as with other local hotels. The staff keeps the ground immaculate and the pool area offers a shaded courtyard with TV, Ice Water and lemonade as well as cups. We also rented surfboard in Lahaina and they stored them for us in a secured location near the pool area. Gym is small but functional and the bell service upon check-in was top notch. I loved having a ground floor unit with a huge patio area and not having to wait for an elevator. Our location had easy access to pool, beach and parking. This place is classy with a capital C. I know that it can be expensive, we stayed here through a promotion with Marriott, which is the property located right next door. Marroitt is beginning to build a new tower in the parking lot right next to the Alii and I thing there will be construction noise in building 3 for the next couple of years. We hit it at the right time with just survey work going on right now. We payed only $1500 for the week including all maid services, taxes and fees. I was a real bargain and steal. Even if you have to pay more, I feel that it is worth the price. If you want a great location with plenty of space and superior service this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Loved every bit of it!!”
Reviews.Author: MacyandDan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Kaanapali Alii for 6 nights with our 3 boys. From the moment we walked in, we were not disappointed. We stayed in unit 143, which is considered an "independent" unit through Maui Beachfront Rentals. (Despite the unit number, it was a 4th floor unit.) The non-independent units are managed by Classic Resorts. The main difference is that CR runs the property. If something goes awry in the independant units, you will need to call Maui Beachfront Rentals to fix it. Other than that, the check in, etc is all the same. The staff was A+, especially Jere (front desk) and Henson (bell person). Housekeeping is weekly, not daily, which I actually prefer. We had viewed our unit online in advance, and while it appeared nice, it is not a remodeled unit with granite countertops, etc. We were fine with that, we have 3 boys, so we prefer non-museum quality digs. But to our surprise, the unit was much much nicer than it even appears on the website.
