Full kitchen, equipped with all dishes, cooking utensils, breadmaker, ricecooker, can opener, coffee maker, etc, etc. It even had a wine cooler!!! The washer dryer were accompanied by detergent, an ironing board, a utility sink ( for sandy beach things!!) etc. The master bath had a hair dryer. The 2 bedrooms were HUGE, and could have easily accomodated cribs, playpens or more rollaway beds. Each bedroom had a TV in it and a full bath next to it, tub /toilet /bidet/shower room separated from vanity, which is nice. Den had sofa bed and TV. LR had a sofa bed and music system, complete with cd's and tapes. Lanai was huge. I think this unit was approx 1900 sf. Our unit faced the Westin, to the north. We had both a view of the beach to the left, the mountains to the right, and the waterfall at the Westin straight in front of us. The waterfall was rather soothing, since Kaanapali is heavily populated with tourists. On occassion the Westin would have a party below, but it always ended at a decent hour, and was not unpleasant to us. We found this unit through More Hawaii 4 Less.com. We compared 4 properties in the immediate area, including Maui Ocean Club, and this was by far more bang for the buck for us. (Of course, availability affected prices, I'm sure.) We were quoted more money for much less in accomodations. We really took advantage of being able to eat in as needed, and made full use of the washing machine, so we had a lot of room for souvenirs, etc. We did stop at Costco on the way, but truthfully we would probably have done better at the Safeway. Even with a family of 5, we had leftovers of the Costco sizes of things. I would highly recommend getting meat /milk/fruit at Costco. I have to warn you, it was a zoo, full of pushy mainlanders, just like at home. We did pack our own cereal, snacks, coffee, crystal light, seasonings, pasta, etc in our luggage. As promised, the barbeques at KA are the nicest on the beach, and we and many others made full use of them. The pool is plain, but does the trick and has plenty of lounge chairs. They also have sand chairs for the beach in front of the complex. You can also rent the big covered chairs (they call it a cabana) for a very reasonalbe sum of $20 per half day. Well worth it, and you get full sun coverage. If your kids want floaties, rings, etc... just NICELY ask the pool shack guys if they have any leftovers from the tourists. There is a bin behind the pool shack with tons of stuff leftover, and they happily gave us some gently used swim rings. The Hyatt Regency is a few properties to the south, and is worth a visit. If I ever win the lotto, I will stay there! Do as we did, walk around, have some coffee and fresh pineapple at the little coffee stand just off the lobby. You can sit outdoors and enjoy their Koi pond, parrots, pengiuns and african cranes while sipping an inexpensive coffee. Then you can go back to your spacious condo. Whalers Village Shopping Center is just 5 walking minutes via beach pathway from KA. There is an ABC store ( Hawaii's version of 7/11, only with more souvenirs.) in the center, for milk, soda, liquor, condiments, etc. There is a Louis Vuitton, Tiffany and Coach store in this center as well. I will warn you, we thought the food court stunk. The coffee stand we liked, and we had excellent cocktails at the Rusty Harpoon. Try the Ginger Mango Martini, YUM. We enjoyed coffee and breakfast on the lanai every day, and I still miss it. The birds we saw were incredible, and sang to us all day! The KA is not an inexpensive property, but we waited 13 years to take this trip, and it was worth every penny. We highly recommend this property to larger famiy groups. Although there were many families staying there, we found it to be fairly quiet property, other than an occassional screaming tot. Not a lot of young single partiers. Location was good, and not far from the activities we chose. Traffic, compared to SoCal, was never evident. We visited Kula, Ma'alea, and Lahaina and had no trouble getting to them in a rental car. We highly recommend the following activities: Warren and Annabelle-Lahaina. Excellent grown up activity. Surfing Goat Dairy in Kula. Fun, GREAT cheese, and we fell in love with Kula. UFO Parasailing and Banana Boat Ride. Hailamaile General Store, which is really a restaurant. in an old general store. Excellent. Trilogy Maui to Lanai Cruise. Amazing, and we will definately do it again. The crew was the absolute best ever, the trip was well worth it for us. I plan on writing reviews for all of the above as soon as I can, here on trip advisor. We will definately be saving us to visit this property again. We hope you have as much fun as we did. Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “Owners first, guests last.”
Reviews.Author: steve_ricks
Reviews.Content: We arrived for a 3 day stay and were greeted with a 'free upgrade' to a newly renovated condo. We were given notices of 'construction noise' between the hours of 10:00 AM to 2:00 PM. I thought how nice it was for them to limit noise since we sometimes like to nap in the afternoon. We soon discovered 2 things: the construction noise is ALL DAY. The 10-2 time frame is for jackhammers and small nuclear explosions; anything else is considered not a problem for the guests. Unfortunately our 'upgraded' unit happened to be right below a unit undergoing renovation. We heard hammering, banging, sawing, and general loud noises all day. We called the desk and they said they would take care of it. Security denied seeing anyone in the units above us, but the noise never went away until about 5 or 6 at night. If you value quiet this may not be the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Beautiful Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: ctaylor66062
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our stay in Maui at the Kaanapali Alii 5/18/07 â€“ 5/26/07. My husband, myself & our 3 year old daughter. I miss it already. We stayed in 332 a 3rd floor "premier garden view." We felt it was very worth the money spent to upgrade to a "Premier" unit. Our unit was a 1 bedroom with a "den" (2nd bedroom which was open to the living room.) This unit had a pretty good view of the ocean and the mountain, gardens and a parking lot. I was really surprised that we were able to see the ocean and the mountain (mountain when on the patio.) Our unit was very nicely decorated. Beautiful granite and fully stainless kitchen. Our room was extremely clean. Every day our housekeeper would vacuum, mop the floors, clean the bathrooms, replenish towels and make our beds (They donâ€™t do dishes.) Our house keeper remembered our names even when we would see her on the grounds away from our room she would always say "Hello Mr. & Mrs. Taylor". That really impressed me. On our 1st full day of staying at the Alii we found a note from management stating there was going to be loud construction for several days from 10am-2pm. We were really upset at the thought of having tons of noise close to our unit. Much to our relief, we heard very little noise the entire stay. It turned out that it wasn't a big deal at all! If I had to come up with one complaint about our unit it would be that the sectional sofa was old. It had some small holes in it and it smelled like B.O., and the carpet needed a good cleaning.... (Okay that's two complaints...both minor.) The entire facility far exceeded my expectations. The staff was exceptional. On our day of check out I called the front desk to see if we could check out later then the normal 11:00am. The staff was more than happy to accommodate us free of charge. They allowed us to stay until 2:00pm, which allowed us some time at the pool that morning. The grounds were gorgeous. They were very lush. Lots of flowering trees. The grounds were very well maintained. The pool was nice. It is not as big and fancy as some of the neighboring properties, but it was fine for our needs. My daughter could not get enough of the pool....especially the baby pool. The baby pool was just deep enough for me and my husband to sit in (water up to my shoulders) while my daughter played in it. It can get quite full with all the kids and parents, but it was fun to chat with the other parents while the kids played. The pools (big & baby pools) are tiled and were a bit slippery. My 3 year old slipped on a step and bumped the back of her head on the edge of the pool. The patio area around the pool should probably be redone. It looks pretty, but is also slippery and is starting the crumble. Be careful when walking with wet feet on the pool deck! They have more than enough pool loungers with nice lounge chair terry clothe covers in addition to nice thick beach towels for all of the guests. They have a water and ice machine, along with pop machine and complementary lemonade (afternoons only for lemonade) available in the pool area. There is also a concierge person located at the pool. She was able to book all of our activities with only a days notice. We found we paid less going through her, rather then another activity planner. They actually work for Expedia and we saved quite a bit of money with them. We really enjoyed staying at the Alii. It was located on a nice beach, which wasn't overly crowded. It is just about a 5 minute (or less) walk to Whaler's Village, which has several nicer restaurants and a few food court type places to eat. Whaler's Village has a nice mix of shops; including an ABC store which seems to have just about everything we needed (milk, bread, etc.) There is also a Safeway grocery store, about a 10 min. drive away in Lahina. To some it up, the Alii was a wonderful place to stay. It's in the center of everything you want to do, yet far enough away to avoid to problems of city life. We are already talking about when we are going to go back. When we do, we will definitely stay at the Kaanapali Alii!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great for families!”
Reviews.Author: nabincalifornia
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a two week stay at the Alli. We booked a two bedroom/premier ocean view unit. We had our three boys (13, 8, 4) with us. For the first time ever, we seemed to have enough room. The unit was so roomy and comfortable. We had 3 TVs (which is important when you have the range in ages we do) and the location was awesome. We BBQ'd pretty much every night and met some great people. The pool is simple, but clean and they have fresh brewed coffee in the morning and refreshing lemon water during the day. Nothing outrageously fancy about this place...no water slides, live music, or restaurants on the property, but a fabulous location, great service and the most relaxing resort we've stayed at in Maui. A HUGE plus...room charge privileges at the Marriott, Sheraton and Westin. The yoga/pilates class on the beach in the morning was wonderful too. I'll never stay anywhere else in Maui after staying at the Alli.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Accomodations!”
Reviews.Author: parkcitygal
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Kaanapali Aliâ€™i from March 30-April 6, 2007. We reserved a 2-BR ocean view condo (not premier). We were interested in getting a good viewâ€¦renovations were second on our list. Our travel agent called many times the weeks before stating what was important to us. The day we arrived, she called again and was offered a premier unit on the 4th floor (our room was 243). We had a nice view of the ocean (see pictures)â€¦there were palm trees between us and the ocean, but they didnâ€™t block us from seeing the ocean (in other words, we didnâ€™t have to get creative to see the ocean). The 2 bedroom units are hugeâ€¦it is truly a 3 bedroom! Our unit had a master bedroom with a king bed, another bedroom with two double beds and a den with a pull-down Murphy bed (double or queen I think). The den had a TV in it and was attached to one of the bathrooms. Each bathroom had two sinks, marble tile and each was very roomy. The kitchen had all of the utensils and cookware needed. There was plenty of dishwasher detergent, dish soap, paper towels, etc. There was a washer/dryer and laundry detergent (Tide powder) was filled up regularly (you donâ€™t need to take your own). The balcony was huge (had a table for 4 and a chaise lounge). Our unit really had more room than our family of four needed. Housekeeping came every day and changed sheets and towels. We usually put our dishes in the dishwasher ourselves but the last day we didnâ€™t and housekeeping took care of it. We grilled out at the complex grills and always found them to be very clean. The location of the complex was great and never felt crowdedâ€¦we walked down the beach toward the Sheraton, and that was really crowded. We were happy we were staying where we were! In the Whalers Village area, we ate at Leilaniâ€™s, Tropico and hit the food court several times. All great food! It was nice to have an ABC store nearbyâ€¦if you need extra milk or yet another pineapple! The beach was pretty rough for our kids (10 & 13) while we were there. The waves broke right at the shore and they got the wind knocked out of them several times. We bought boogie boards but only used them one or two days. Body surfing was much safer. We saw that over and over again (with other people â€“ young and old alike) while we were there. If you walk down towards Whalerâ€™s Village, the ocean seems to get calmer. One of my ONLY complaints about the Kaanapali Aliâ€™i was the chair situation at the beach. There are no complimentary chaise lounges for the beach. They have complimentary beach chairs (sand chairs)â€¦and then they have cabana beach chaise lounges for $40 per day (2 chaise lounges with shade). The problem is they donâ€™t have enough lounges for everyone there. You have to reserve the day before to get one the next day. The pool attendant said that people line up at 8AM the day before just to reserve the cabanas for the next day! We thought that was ridiculous for the money youâ€™re paying to stay thereâ€¦why not trade out the beach chairs for chaise lounges??? We reserved the cabana beach chairs one day but found that our kids went back and forth between pool and beach so much that they just werenâ€™t worth the money (we felt since we paid for them we should be using them!) There ARE complimentary chaise lounges at the pool which we ended up using every day. We never really had a problem finding open chairs. Yes, there are those people who go down early and put their towels down. But the pool staff usually clears them out after 2 hours (which is great!) During the day, there was complimentary coffee and cold lemonade down by the pool. There was also an ice machine with a water dispenser and a soda machine (we ended up using only half of our bottled water because fresh water was so readily available down at the pool). There was also a big screen TV down by the pool and shade for those who just had to see their sports (the Final Four and Masters were on while we were there so it was a great touch!) We took two boat excursions while we were there. The first was with Aqua Adventures (a snorkel/snuba trip to Molokini and Turtle Arches). They were top-notch with good food and service. There were about 32 people on board which made it one of the smallest snorkel operations out there. The second was an all-day sail to Lanaâ€™i with Paragon. This was our favorite trip. There were less than 24 people on board (I think the boat holds 49?) and we were never crowded! We sailed over to Lanaâ€™i, snorkeled an hour and then we were taken to a beautiful beach for about an hour and a half to have a deli lunch and swim in the ocean. The sail back was a fun, wet one (if you wanted it to be) and we saw whales breaching and flapping their fins. It was great! Other restaurants we ate at were Roys (love their Dark Chocolate Souffle), Pacific O (the best meal we had!), Haliâ€™imaile General Store (we ate their on our last night before heading to the airport). All were great meals. We also did the Old Lahaina Luau and it was wonderful. Weâ€™ve been to several others over the years but this one is our favorite. Its very authentic, has wonderful food and isnâ€™t hokey. Our kids really enjoyed it. All in all, Maui and the Kaanapali Aliâ€™i were great choices for our vacation this year!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and spacious”
Reviews.Author: SnowBunnySanMateo
Reviews.Content: The Ali'i was gorgeous. We stayed in a 1 bedroom which had a bonus room with a double bed which was perfect for my daughters. The one bedroom was 1500 sq feet and was equipped with every comfort of home. The location was ideal, right on the beach and walking distance to shops. There are gas bbq's next to the pool and plenty of tables for outdoor dining. We saved a fortune cooking ourselves. I highly recommend this place for families.

Reviews.Title: “Great Condos For Families”
Reviews.Author: Boy_Scout
Reviews.Content: The Kaanapali Alii is a great place to stay with family. We stayed in unit 256, a "mountain view" room. This was a 2 bedroom, 2 bath unit. About 1700 square feet. The master bedroom had a king size bed. The second bedroom had two double beds. The sofa in the living room was also a sleeper. The unit had a complete kitchen (stove, range, microwave, coffee maker, refrigerator/freezer, dishwasher). The unit also had a washer and dryer in a small laundry room off the foyer. It had a TV in the living room and both bedrooms. Also cable internet for an extra charge (about $40 for the week). Parking is free. Some of it is covered. The covered parking is first come. The unit also had a porch with tables and chairs. We ate breakfast out there most mornings. The Alii is within easy walking distance of Whalers Village. There's no restaurant or bar on the property, but the Westin provides room service (expensive) and you have charging priviledges at the Westin, Marriott and Sheraton. If you want a drink at the pool, go down to Whalers Village to the ABC store and get what you want. You'll save a lot of money. In the morning they have coffee by the pool. Later in the day they have hot tea and lemonade. All gratis. The property has a sundry store, bell service and a concierge for booking activities, restuarant reservations, etc. There's also a place at the pool to rent surfboards, etc. as well as obtain towels. There were plenty of lounge chairs both around the pool and available for use at the beach. Daily maid service is provided, but the maid doesn't do dishes. The staff was very friendly. The bellman who showed us to our room was particularly helpful. I haven't rented a condo before, but the Alii has spoiled me. If I'm traveling with my adult children in the future, I'm definitely going to go the condo route.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place for the family”
Reviews.Author: Karasdad
Reviews.Content: My wife and I along with our two girls, ages 3 & 5, and my mother in law just returned from eight days here. We had a nice two bedroom lanai ocean view with a den which provided lots of room and sleeping accomodations for all of us. The room was on the tenth floor and had fabulous ocean and beach views from every room including the dining room. We originally had a third floor room but it overlooked the parking lot and there was a notice that noisy work would be done on the floor during the day so we requested a change and were accomodated. It is a quiet, clean, and peaceful location with good service. We found the decor a bit tired and not quite up to our expectations for paying the top rate of $695 plus tax per night for peak season but the view was worth most of it. They need to throw out all the VHS players and replace them with DVD players. Internet access, both wireless and wired, was available at reasonable cost. The grounds are immaculate and the pool is fun for the little ones. The surf on the beach is a bit rough for the little ones but they still had fun. Whalers Village, just a few blocks away is getting very tired. It was nice to have the kitchen so we could eat in, and the outdoor grills by the pool are great, super clean and well maintained. Food at the Whalers Village is just tourist stuff, nice locations but not much in the way of good fast food. Good parking at the Kaanapali Alii too. Skip the work out facility, small and dingy. We were very pleased to find all the guests and employees so friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Ah, paradise at the Kaanapali Alii”
Reviews.Author: oneyearoff
Reviews.Content: Three generations of women from my family (my mother, sister, niece and I) stayed at the Alii February 13 - 18, 2007 and we could not have been more pleased. Our unit, 171, was stylish and comfortable, with top quality furnishings. We had a view from the lanai of the ocean and Moloka'i (over the Westin pool area) to the left and those fabulous West Maui mountains to the right. It was a one bedroom, but in addition to the master suite, it had a den with a comfortable queen bed and its own bathroom. You don't need a 2 bedroom with features like this! Plus a full, brand new kitchen, dining area, living room and entry way. The owners have great taste and you could tell by the small extras that they they care about their guests. I was so grateful the management honored my request for a special unit, since this was a special trip for us. The location is fabulous. You walk across impossibly green lawns to the beach promenade and join the others, coffee in hand, marvelling at the views as you stroll along between the other hotels and restaurants. This was the second time I've stayed at the Alii and I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Family Trip”
Reviews.Author: sammwall
Reviews.Content: We travel yearly to Maui and the last few years have stayed here. Always fantastic. Wonderful location. Very clean, spacious, great accomodations and staff. We hope to go for many more years to come!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect every year!”
Reviews.Author: alohabeckons
Reviews.Content: A large condo, in the perfect location, on a perfect beach? Can't do much better than the Alii. We have stayed here for the past 4 years, after finding it planning a last minute holiday trip, and we won't consider staying anywhere else. For those who say they desperately need to redo the pool area, please book elsewhere. This property does not need waterslides and pirateships to attract occupants, and I don't want to stay with people who require such things at a pool. Over the top friendly and accomodating service, huge condos with full kitchens and plenty of room to spread out and relax, and the immaculate barbecue area make this the place to stay. It's no wonder we always notice people walking the path and looking in, wondering about the place. We have booked throught the hotel and through individual owners, and both have worked out well. Looking forward to going again this year!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way..”
Reviews.Author: djbpetals
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from 12/7 to 12/13. Booked a premier oceanfront condo [unit 125] through Classic Vacations . This place is wonderful. Beautiful landscaping, and a wonderous view from our lanai. The condo was fully updated with more room than we needed. This section of beach was beautiful, with very little crowding and more than enough chairs for the pool area and the beach. There were flowers everywhere you looked, and each condo has window boxes full of thriving, lush plants and flowers. Service was excellent and very friendly as well. Also, they let us do a late check out since our flight home left so late in the evening. I can not find one thing to complain about al all on the whole experience!! It was a wonderful week and We will be going back next year to the Alii. Why change when you find perfection the first time you go??

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Condo great view and beach”
Reviews.Author: PHutchinson
Reviews.Content: booked through Royal Hawaii Condos 888-722-6284. Booked a 2 Bedroom premier unit for a week Oct 23 - Oct 30- absolutely amazing accomodations. Very large. First class service. Best beach. We arrived with luggage and tons of groceries from Costco. They take your keys and unload everything for you! Went to Warren and Annabelle show in Lahaina - highly recommend it. Book ahead. Snorkel at Black rock at the end of the beach- lots of fish, swam with a sea turtle. Took a 4 hour sailing trip on the Scotch Mist out of Lahaina. Very cool. Best Meal - Roy's!

Reviews.Title: “Love! Love! LOVED it!!”
Reviews.Author: jlanderos
Reviews.Content: My husband, toddler and I stayed at the Alii from Sept. 15 throught the 23rd. The place was AMAZING!! Stayed in unit 252! Totally updated and clean!!! The staff were great! The location was great! The pool was great!! EVERYTHING WAS GREAT!!! If you are looking for a reaxing get away, stay here!!

Reviews.Title: “Home in Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: travellinghopefully
Reviews.Content: Luxury and the best service in paradise, the Alii is the place to stay! While it may not have a fancy waterslide, it also doesn't have the screaming crowds that populate the resort hotels. The condos are immaculate and beautifully decorated with lanais to relax on. The barbecues are an extra touch that were much appreciated. The beach is lovely and uncrowded and the comfortable cabanas further enhance your stay on the beach. The servicew at the reception and the pool is impeccable, and I have never dealt with a housekeeping service that is so accommodating. So forget the waterslides and stay in a place truly compatible with paradise-the Alii.

Reviews.Title: “Best Vacation Ever!”
Reviews.Author: stahr
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 just returned from a glorious 8 day trip to Maui. We opted to stay in a condo because we were travelling with our three college-age children. We booked through Royal Hawaiian Condos which we found online. Though we booked many months in advance, a premier unit was not available. However, we were assured that if we were dissatisfied with our room, an acceptable unit would be found. When we arrived at the hotel, they very graciously told us that a premier unit would be available the following night. Because we had an all-day hike planned the following day (Maui Eco-Adventures: Highly recommended!), they advised us to leave our packed bags in the first unit's foyer and upon our return, we would be completely relocated to the new unit. The first condo was somewhat dated, with stained carpeting and barely acceptable bathrooms. The premier unit was absolutely magnificent, similar to others described on this site. The upcharge was a mere $35/night, and we were relocated effortlessly--and, to the 10th floor with a view straight up to Black Rock and across to Molokai'i, compared to the other unit which was on the 3rd floor in a different building and offered a limited ocean view. From the moment we checked in, until the moment we left, every staff member was extremely friendly and accommodating. The condominium was huge--ideal for a family of our size--and should really be regarded as a 3 bedroom rather than a 2 bedroom as described. The grounds are meticulously maintained and quite lush. Though the pool is relatively small compared to neighboring hotels' elaborate layouts, the Ali'i has plenty of chaises and ample availability of towels and chair covers. There's always ice water and lemonade available poolside. In addition, attentive staff members are never too far away. A limited continental breakfast is available poolside daily beginning around 8 AM. The location is ideal and offers the perfect blend of condo living with hotel amenities. Having a washer/dryer available in the unit allows you to pack less (and leave room for purchases!), which is especially important considering airlines' strict baggage weight limits. Individual air-conditioning controls in each living area were a huge advantage, with this caveat: If you don't completely close the sliding doors to the lanai, the a/c shuts off, an understandable design feature. We grilled fresh fish (ono, hebi, mahi mahi, opah--purchased at The Fish Market located on nearby Lower Honoapili'ini Road) and had delightful sunset dinners on our lanai. The process of cooking on the world's cleanest grills was thoroughly enjoyable, allowing us to meet fellow guests from all over the world, some of whom were returning to the Ali'i for their 10th year! We have taken elaborate vacations with our family all over the world, staying in 5 star venues, and can heartily endorse the Ali'i as being in a class with the best we've seen and experienced. Comments by others who stayed here regarding water shutoffs and other disruptions due to construction were accurate, but the hotel handled these extremely minor inconveniences in a fine manner and our stay was in no way affected. We regard the Ali'i as a true "find," and breathed a great sigh of relief as we settled in and realized that what was once a complete "wild card," turned into the major factor that made this the best vacation ever.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Alli....Gig Harbor, Washington”
Reviews.Author: phscoach
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Alli for 10 days in late June to early July. We had never been to Maui and were very much pleased with the service, cleanliness and friendly staff. Weather of course was perfect. Numerous restaurants and shops within a short walk. Pool was small but really didn't matter as we spent about 95% of our time at the beach. Towel supply was endless. Advice is get to the beach early, like around 8-9am to get a chair. Sunset is early, around 7:30. We have already told friends about our stay and would recommend it to anyone. We are trying to figure out when we can go again !

Reviews.Title: “Just loved Hawaii!”
Reviews.Author: Mayak
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 5 night stay at the Kaanapali Alii from 6-29 to 7-04. It was our first visit to Hawaii and we took our two teenage daughters. One of the reasons we picked the Alii was because of the extra space and the kitchen. These were wonderful to have and we ate most breakfasts at the hotel. It was nice to have a fridge to keep the fresh pineapple and guacamole cold that we bought from the local farmer's market. All in all, we absolutely loved Maui, snorkeling, the beach etc. It was clean, safe, and has a beautiful ocean for swimming. The location of the Alii is perfect....right next to Whaler's Village and on a great stretch of beach close enough to walk to Black Rock for snorkeling. However, the other reviews are correct. They desperately need a new pool area. Our girls kept trying to sneak in to the Westin or the Marriott's pools because they were so much nicer. So if you have teenagers you might want to consider that. Otherwise, the Alii lived up to it's good reviews although we would probably stay at the Marriott next time.

Reviews.Title: “A second home”
Reviews.Author: Erzengel
Reviews.Content: It's been a while since we actually stayed at the Kaanapali Alii, but it was so great, I had to share the experience. We stayed here in October 2005, and it was like having a second home in Maui. First of all, the location is great. The hotel is on the southern end of Kaanapali Beach, between Whaler's Village and the Hyatt and Marriott resorts, so it's quiet and not crowded at all. The grounds are beautiful and well kept. There's a pool, but we never used it. The beach is just a few steps away!!! Secondly, the staff is wonderful. Before we drove to the hotel, we stopped at Costco to stock up on groceries and snacks, so in addition to all our luggage, we had boxes and boxes of food. The staff took care of it all. They unloaded our car while we checked in, valet parked our car (at no charge), and when we were ready, gave us a tour of the grounds and escorted us to our condo. Housekeeping staff was friendly and kept our condo immaculate. Thirdly, the condo was huge! It was 1500 sq. feet, which is bigger than some people's houses. It had one bedroom with a king sized bed, two full baths (yes!), a fully stocked kitchen (utensils, pots, pans, glassware, serving dishes, dish soap, everything!), living room, dining room, another small area with a sofa bed, a laundry room (with detergent), and a great lanai. I paid about $450 per night, but it was worth it, considering all the space and amenities. A 360sq. ft. room at the Westin next door would have cost the same. Of course, not everything can be perfect. There were a few things that could have made our stay even better, such as: 1. I should have booked an updated unit. Our condo was nice, but it was starting to look a little old. The bathrooms could have used a remodel. 2. I had booked a full ocean view and paid a premium for it, but what we got was more like a partial ocean view. From the lanai, you kinda had to crane your neck to see the ocean. We had a better view of the West Maui mountains. When I complained, they said they could move us to a unit with a better view, but when we saw all the stuff that had to be moved again, we decided to stay in our current one. Finally, just don't pass on the Kaanapali Alii. It's wonderful. If you want to feel like you've come home to Maui, this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Stay at the Alii”
Reviews.Author: vadreamer
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a visit to the Kannapali Alii and it was great. The room exceeded our expectations. Rented through Great Hawaii Vacations at the best price I could find. We had a one bedroom premier ocean view (lanai). To our surprise, the den had been converted to a bedroom, so our son was able to have his own bedroom, very convenient. Kitchen and baths had granite countertops and beautiful tile throughout the bathrooms. The unit was tastefully decorated. Although we had requested a room in building 1 or 3 (the closest to the water), our room was located in building 2 on the 5th floor. I'm trying to remember the room number, I think it was 252, but not completely sure. The only negative would be the view from the room. While we could see some of the ocean to the left when standing on the lanai, we heard the service vehicles in the parking area just below our lanai all during the day, so keeping the lanai sliding doors open was a little noisy. We arrived late in the evening (10:00 p.m.) because of airline problems, but I called to let them know we would be late and they were very accommodating. The bellman was quick to get our luggage and park our car which was appreciated as we were quite tired. He was very knowledgeable about the area and offered some good suggestions regarding groceries and places to eat. Loved being able to walk to Whaler's Village for shopping and dining. The beach was beautiful and our son loved the waves in this area of the beach. Wasn't able to get any of the cabannas, as they get "reserved" early. You know, those people who go out early and place their towels on the lounges and then disappear. That was a little annoying, but it seems that's what people do everywhere. I would definately recommend the Alii. The staff was great, the room was wonderful and you can't beat the location.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with our stay at the Kaanapali Alii :-)”
Reviews.Author: happyscrapper
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our recent stay at the Kaanapali Alii. There were 6 people in our party and all of us thought it was simply beautiful and we couldn't have been happier with our accomodations. We stayed in Unit 223 which is a 2 bedroom with a living room and a separate den. However, in Unit 223 the den has been converted into a 3rd bedroom. This was perfect for our family! I had a hard time finding a 3 bedroom condo on Kaanapali Beach and was so excited to have found this one! It is very spacous with lovely furnishings. The Kaanapali Alii does not have a restaurant, but its withing walking distance to Whaler's Village with its fabulous restaurants and fun shops. Each morning during our stay there was a free continental breakfast set up by the pool and for lunch, we either ate a the food court in Whaler's Villlage or walked to the Marriott next door to their Beachwalk Pantry by the pool. We found the staff at the Kaanapali Alii to be very friendly and efficient. Even though we did not rent directly through them (we rented through Maui Beach Rentals) they were extremely helpful whenever we had a question. Check-in was a breeze....it took only a few minutes.....our luggage was unloaded from our car by an employee and the car parked in the garage before we could even blink our eyes!!! WOW! What great service!! And the same service was given when we checked out. You can't go wrong with the Kaanapali Alii. It's just an awesome place and I envy those of you who will be staying there in the near future! :-)

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Place”
Reviews.Author: mauirocks
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Alii from June 1st to the 8th and had a wonderful time. The Alii staff were all very nice and the grounds were beautiful. This is a great place to stay if you have kids because the rooms are like little apartments, they are huge. We stayed in room 292 and it was so nice. It was a premier room (which they upgraded us to after a complaint about a urined smelly couch) it was awesome. A wonderful view of the islands and the ocean. This location is nice because you can just walk down to Whaler village to eat and shop, and the ocean is right there in front of you. Six days out of eight my kids and I were able to swim in the ocean (I have a 3 year old and 6 year old so we needed something calm) the other days we drove a 15 min drive up to Kapulua Bay. Lahaina is right down the way too, so you can drive down there to shop and there is a little kid friendly beach right before you get to Lahina that we discovered too. I liked Lahania a lot too, it was so cute, I suggest to get there early in the morning to snag a good parking spot and before it gets too hot. I loved this place and I will definitely be back as soon as we can save up for it again :).

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in an updated condo, 2 bedroom, 2 bath with mountain views. Rooms were spacious with 2 queen beds for our 4 kids. Easy walk to the beach with lots of activities. Signed up with Expedia travel people on site for Maui activities, expensive but everyone had fun. Would definitely stay there again but units are different based on updating, etc. We lucked out! Pool was fair and we did not use, needs to be redone based on Hyatt and other pools in the area.

Reviews.Title: “The Best!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Kaanapali Alii for 9 days in late May and early June. We stayed in unit 485, and the accommodations were excellent. Nice two bedroom layout with the bedrooms separated for privacy, probably 2,000 sq feet. Wonderful kitchen with reasonably good utensils for cooking. Beautiful Mountain View and corner location with windows all around made you feel like you were outside. Beautiful. The BBQ grills down by the pool were cleaned every morning to like new condition. We enjoyed many a BBQ. The location is in the best part Kaanapali beach if you like surfing, sun bathing, or just relaxing on the beach. Beautiful section of beach. Whalerâ€™s village is a 5 minute walk; Black Rock with its great snorkeling is a 20 minute walk. Lahaina is 5 minutes away, as is the Lahaina Luau. Lahaina Harbor is 10 minutes away. Golf is across the street. The only slight negative I would give the Kaanapali Alii is the pool, but I understand that they are going to redo it, making it larger than it currently is. Donâ€™t know the timeframe for that change, but it will be a welcomed change. If you want a 2 bedroom condo, great location, very nice accommodations, stop looking. This is the place for you. No on-site restaurant, but food can be delivered, although we never tried that. Many beach-side restaurants with a 5-10 minute walk. Lahaina has a Safeway that is 5 minutes away. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect vacation spot”
Reviews.Author: lovestotravelwithyou
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Kaanapali Alii for a month in May. The condos were spacious and included everything you could possibly want--washer/dryer, full kitchen, etc. We were in a two bedroom unit that had been upgraded. It had about 1900 sq. ft. and laid out so you didn't hear anything from one bedroom to the other. The staff was very helpful and acommodating. The pool wasn't as big as the large hotel resorts, but it was quite adequate. There were BBQ's you could use and they had coffee out in the morning and then lemonade in the afternoon. The location was perfect. Walking distance to all the other hotels and Whaler's Village and only 10 minutes to Lahaina. If we were to go back to Kaanapali, we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Only the Alii for meheeee”
Reviews.Author: Ju-Ju
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Alii April 17-24, 2006. We had a variety of ages from 24-70. All were happy with the Alii and it's closeness to entertainment, beach activities, shops and restaurants. Our 2 bedroom condo with a den was perfect and as in other reviews---the sunset!! We also saw 2-3 whales from our lanai slapping around between the islands. All the staff was very friendly. The bellmen were especially friendly. We had the same one take us to our condo that did the last time we were here almost 2 years ago. I needed extra silverware for a party that we were hosting and they were very accomodating. The Alii is always updating and I didn't mind the little inconviences that come with that. It was interesting watching the man climb up the palm trees and trim of the palm leaves. He was pretty quick goin up and down and swaying up at the top. Not a job for me! We won't consider ever staying anywhere else on Maui even alfter looking around Wailea where some frineds were staying.

Reviews.Title: “Ohhhh , the Sunsets .....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 4 night stay 4/16-4/20 at the Kaanapali Alii. The buildings and grounds are very clean, the Palm tress and other plants are very well maintained, the pool is adequate and our particular unit #446 ocean view, was very nice. But the location is A+++++. The beach is perfectly located and the path the follows the beach is a very nice evening stroll or early morning jog/walk. The Whaler's Village (shopping/food etc. ) is down the path too. The sunsets every evening were spectacular! The warm winds were very relaxing especially by the pool. The check in clerk was a little reserved and not very friendly. But when we ran out of towels and laundry soap, they were very quick to replace both. Be sure and try Aloha Mixed Plate (behind the Safeway) for lunch or dinner. Authentic Hawaii food without paying "luau" prices. We also did the "Bike down a volcano tour" and it was a very memorable day. Be warned, be prepared to face your fear of heights if you have any...We will return to Maui and would stay here again, but try a Ocean Front next time.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Condo!”
Reviews.Author: OceanloverOH
Reviews.Content: Just spent a week in the Kaanapali Alii. Best condo we've ever been in! Very 1st class and plush. Booked thru Classic Vacations. Lovely view of ocean, beach and Lana'i. Location was the best; nearby Whaler's Village for shopping, Black Rock for snorkeling, etc. Highly recommend the KA to anyone (be sure to specify PREMIER, though, for the upgraded condos).

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Kaanapali Alii”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Kaanapali Alii in room 441, which was really nice. I booked it through Maui Beachfront Rentals. The complex is very nice and clean, and the grounds are well kept. I thought the pool was nice-not as glamorous as some of the others but who wants to swim in a pool all day when you have a beautiful beach right there? The beach in front of the condo is really nice compared the beach area near Black Rock which is small and crowded. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Resort”
Reviews.Author: tippicanoe
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time at the Alii. Our 10th floor unit was right on the oceanfront with a huge lanai where we watched whales every morning. We had a two bedroom, two bath condo, beautifully furnished and updated, so much more room than a hotel room. We were able to make breakfast in the state-of-the-art kitchen, eat at our dining room table if we wanted to (although we usually ate at our large patio table on the lanai) and relax in our hugeliving room complete with a 42 inch TV and stereo. The location on Kaanapali Beach is perfect, with the walkway along the beach a great way to get around to restaurants. We had full maid service every day and the staff of the Alii was very friendly and helpful. The pool was much nicer than we had been led to believe in other reviews, not as fancy as some hotel pools but meticulously maintained with a great hot tub. We never had a problem getting a chair at the pool, although we preferred the beach cabana chairs you could rent through the activity center. We had the concierge book several or our tours and we appreciated the small store on site to pick up a few things. We discovered the ABC store in Whaler's Village (about a 5-10 minute walk) for other foodstuffs and alcohol and wine. We checked out all the hotels on the beach, all of them beautiful with friendly staffs but when we come back we will stay again at the Alii...the best of the best.

Reviews.Title: “First trip to Maui”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family enjoyed our first trip to Maui. We stayed at the Kaanapali Alii, room 434, on Kaanapali Beach. The room was very spacious. The room could easily sleep 6 adults comfortably. The room had a king bed, queen bed and 2 full size beds. The decor was a little dated but the entire facility was clean, the staff extremely helpful, and a great location. Due to its central location, you can shop at Whaler's Village, snorkel at Black Rock, or enjoy dining with a short walk. This is a great location for a family vacation. We will look forward to our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “At home at the Alii”
Reviews.Author: loPDXer
Reviews.Content: What a spectacular place. Quiet, clean, elegantly designed and equipped. My wife love the 8 nozzle master shower in our 2 bedroom unit. Staff were efficient and unobtrusive. The kitchen allowed us relief from dining out and peaceful mornings with our kids on our schedule. Unlike a hotel, this was just like home and a great rest in paradise while waking up to the ocean views.

Reviews.Title: “2nd Stay @ Alii; Great time had by all...Again!”
Reviews.Author: 57sport
Reviews.Content: This a late post versus when our family visited the Alii. This was our second time at the Alii (see 1st post on 7/8/04) and we had a magnificent time. Our visit was 6/25-7/2/05. When I booked the room, directly via Classic Resorts, I mentioned that we were repeat visitors and we were given a discount! We requested a high floor, premier ocean view room. Having stayed in '04, we were quite familiar with the layout and knew which building would give us the best view and requested Bldg 4. Upon arrival, we were told that there were no high floors available, but they could move us to a higher floor in 2 days. Rm#424 was absolutely beautiful and totally upgraded; only problem is that it was on the 2nd floor (only view was of the roof near the swimming pool). We were allowed to preview the room (2 bd/2bth & Murphy bed in living room)before we were moved in and it too was upgraded (#393). Although it wasn't in the bldg we requested, it was a premier ocean view nonetheless. The management was very accomdating during check-in and moving to another room. No attitude, no negativity, no disrespect. My advice is to remain calm & treat others as you would like to be treated and there should be no problem. There were units being renovated during our stay, but was not an imposition at any time. We took the Maui Princess Dinner Cruise + Luau (Royal Lahaina Luau) combo. Both were fantastic. We saw Warren & Annabelle's Magic show (matinee), which was quite entertaining; just getting into the auditorium was "magical"...you'll have to go to find out how much fun that is (remember to use logic). We went on a Submarine ride (educational as well as fun). Hubby enjoyed golfing @ Kaanapali Golf course, across the street (our son got a kick driving the cart). Otherwise, we stayed near our condo, walked to the Whalers' Village, had dinner at restaurants near the Alii, tanned at the beach/pool. Kids did their own thing, keeping in touch via cellphone. Hubby & I walked the path to the Sheraton, had a drink and walked back; it wasn't as far as it looked. We were able to leisurely enjoy party spots and quiet solitude and not once did the kids complain! They're ready to do it again...I wonder, when will they take us to Maui? Tip: we wanted to have a meal at Bubba Gumps, but late afternoon and evening was always busy with nearly 2hr wait; so we went for late lunch, which was easier to get a seat and water view. Front St was less crowded, so we were able to browse w/o the usual crowds. The only thing we didn't get to do was the Road to Hana and parasailing...uhmmmm, seems like another trip is required! When going to Maui, will always stay at the Alii. It's the best of both worlds...again, the pool is not as grand as other hotels, instead it's quite simple, but serves its purpose. Try it and you won't be disappointed, some may think it's pricey, but where else in Maui can you get 2bd/2bth condo with full kitchen (upgraded w/granite counters, dining room, stainless steel appliances), free parking, restaurant privileges, with Alli vouchers, located right on the beach w/magnificent views and rooms 1500-1900 sq ft., for under < $600/nite? You really get what you pay for and then some.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we wanted!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is our second trip to the Kaanapali Alii and it was just as fabulous as the time before. We had a mountain view room on this visit and it was great. The views of the mountains in the morning were breathtaking. It was clean, furnished beautifully and spacious. We used the grill area down by the pool and that was nice to be able to eat lunch out by the pool. The staff were friendly and allowed us to stay in our room past check-out time on the day of our departure to help accomodate our flight time. This place is beautiful, the beach is beautiful and overall it was a wonderful say. I will be back to visit the Alii soon!!! Maui must be the most breathtaking place on earth!!!

Reviews.Title: “Kaanapali Alii is great!”
Reviews.Author: PetalumaTraveler
Reviews.Content: We spent Thanksgiving week at the Alii (Nov 19-26). We had a 2 bedroom, ocean view. We were in building 4 on the 9th floor. Beautiful, amazing view. Sunsets from the lanai were fantastic. The condo itself was huge. A big kitchen, dining room and living room with a huge master suite with a king size bed and a smaller 2nd bedroom with 2 double beds. There were very nice TVs in the living room (with a VCR/DVD) and also in each bedroom. We went with our 3 teenagers (18,17 & 15) and there was plenty of room to spread out. The majority of the condo was tiled, except the bedrooms had carpet. The bathrooms were very nice, great showers. The kitchen looked to be original from the 80s, not very modern, but clean and still very nice. The furniture was nothing fancy, but again, comfortable. It was great to have a full kitchen for breakfasts and lunches. They have 8 gas grills by the pool where you can barbeque at either lunch or dinner. The pool area is not huge, but good size. The pool is free form, again, not huge. The only negative thing I could think of, people would go down to the pool area and stick towels on 4 or 5 lounge chairs at 8 a.m. and then leave for hours, "reserving" the chairs, which you're not supposed to do. We would usually be able to scrounge up a few chairs in the afternoon. The staff was very nice and ready to help you with anything you needed. There was maid service every day and they kept the condo spotless. The location is the best part of the Alii. It is right on Kaanapali Beach, in fact right in the middle of the "beach walk". We hardly used our car, as you can walk to lots of shops and restaurants right from the Alii. Also, the beach is perfect right there. Soft sand, no rocks and great waves. I was a little apprehensive about the Alii after reading some remarks on here, but have to say we thought it was superb. I would highly recommend it to a family. The price was high (I think we paid about $500 a night), but saved so much on meals and not driving around alot, that I think it all evens out in the end. I'm ready to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Expensive, but worth-it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have been to maui several times, the Alii is by far has the best location and is a real 5 star resort.

Reviews.Title: “Watch Out for this One- Don't Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Classic Resorts manages this place. I had two problems. First I reserved a ocean view room and it was not available without making a move during my stay. When I ask for the adjustment for the room difference, they stated that my travel agency needed to make the credit. Guess what the travel agency cannot get the Kaanapali Alii to credit them back the difference. The will not return letters or calls. Second, while out of the room with the do not disturb sign out, Kaanapalli Alii personnel enter my room and search through the luggage and removed a wallet with cash, credit cards and personnel ID. Management denied this account and when I had the Maui police investigate, it was determined that only their employee was in the room at the time of the theft. The Kaanapalli Alii management now just will not return calls or do anything about the incident. For your best, stay out of this place.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: SoCAL53
Reviews.Content: We had been planning a big family trip to Hawaii complete with elderly parents, and toddler, etc. and were looking for a great location with luxurious rooms and great service. The Alii was absolutely perfect. We had two condos, one two bdrm with a murphy bed and another one bdrm with a roll away bed and it was perfect for all of us. We could eat out when we wanted or go to the grocery store and eat a simple lunch; drinks and snacks were always available; we ordered high speed internet so that everyone could watch their stocks and read their emails; the staff was fantastic. There are gas grills by the pool which were cleaned every morning by the staff and we grilled dinner a couple of times. Alot of fun. We didn't have to pay exorbitant resort fees or parking fees etc. was walking distance to all the shops and restaurants in Whaler's village and the beach and ocean were of course beautiful. I would recommend that you ask for an upgraded/remodeled unit when you make your reservations. Our units were beautiful with marble floors and granite counters in the kitchen. Only downside for people with teenagers: pool is rather small and simple; although we loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for family vacation!”
Reviews.Author: choosy-travels
Reviews.Content: We actually booked our stay directly through the individual condo owners, and highly recommend you consider the same! Unit #112,---------, is ocean view, first floor, easy access to pool, beach and parking, and BEAUTIFULLY decorated! The unit is a two-bedroom, though seems slightly smaller than the ~1500 sq ft recommended, but is ample space for a family of four and offers two bedrooms, two baths, which is very convenient! The baths/kitchen are nicely appointed with granite and tile, travertine flooring throughout (except carpet in bedrooms) and the living areas have comfy furniture. We chose to eat in for several of our meals as were traveling with our 2yr old son, who was adjusting to the time zone differences and needed extra rest and peace and quiet to avoid being too overwhelmed - groceries can be purchased ~2.5mi south at the Safeway grocery at Lahaina Cannery Mall. Bring your Safeway/Von's/etc. card so you can get the sale prices! The Kaanapali Alii grills are stainless steel built-ins and very nice and clean, so worth getting some meat/fish to grill out at least once during your stay. Otherwise for cooking in, the Alii #112 has modern stainless appliances and a ceramic flat top cooking surface, in addition to a microwave, coffee maker, and even a blender for making your own Lava Flows! The pool was nice and not overcrowded, though we traveled during an offpeak season. Lots of nice people at the resort who helped with any questions we had. The beach is a bit steep as noted in other reviews, but is silky soft sand and still enough beach to enable playing and getting your feet wet without dropping off into the deeper areas. We recommend that you move over just to the south end of the Alii resort beach area, as is more shallow and seemed to have less coral in the shallow waters as well. The building, like many hotels, can get a bit noisy as seems walls/floors are not well insulated, enabling sounds from condos above and around to be heard, but not so much as to be distracting overall for your peace and quiet. Other points of interest: The Royal Lahaina Resort's Luau just to the north is perfect for those traveling with children as offers a kids' menu of chicken nuggets, French fries, hot dogs, etc. And, the food overall at the Luau was delicious! Lots to offer and all was wonderful. The show itself is also quite good. It was misting rain while we waited in the line outside and the resort/luau management were kind enough to provide plastic ponchos to all guests which I understand at others were offered at a charge! Kimo's Restaurant in Lahaina has great prime rib that melts in your mouth! And, do try the Hula Pie, though recommend that more than one person share it as it's huge! Cheeseburger in Paradise was nice for a lunch out, but recommend Bubba Gump's for similar, but better, food and a very fun atmosphere. Lahaina Fish Company left us unimpressed overall for its seafood, as wasn't the best, or near the best, that we have had, but others seemed to like it well, so might still be worth a try depending on your tastes. If you are interested in a bit more of a drive for seafood, we have been told by several that Mama's Fish House in Kuau is the best - we opted out as again traveling with a two-yr old, so didn't spend a lot of time driving in the car.

Reviews.Title: “A great place for families”
Reviews.Author: travelgirl88
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed at the Ali'i for five nights. I had been a little concerned about whether I'd made the right choice after I saw this website, but I am happy to report we did. Our trip took us to three islands and for this leg of the trip it was nice to have more than one room so each of us could have some privacy and alone time. After seeing some of the reviews, I went back to the travel agent and requested that he put a request through our package booking agent for an upgraded/renovated room. We had a one bedroom with den. We had not even requested the den. The place was very spacious and the furnishings were nice. So convenient to have the full refrigerator, toaster, microwave etc. And the washer/dryer meant we could pack a lot less. They even provide the laundry detergent. The pool is not fancy like some of the resorts, but it was crystal clear. We could hardly keep the kids out of it. There is a large regular pool plus a small kiddie pool and a hot tub. As far as complaints, we paid for a partial ocean view and got pretty much a garden view because the pool house took up much of our view. Had we been one floor higher (third) we'd have had a beautiful ocean view. Also, the place was somewhat damp. There is some construction going on, but we were only affected by the closure of an elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Just be aware of a few things!”
Reviews.Author: bobcriss
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Kaanapali Alii last month with our two boys, 9 and 11. We have been to Hawaii several times and were very excited to stay at the Ali'i because the reviews had been so favorable, but we were actually quite disappointed. When we arrived, the desk clerk took my information and then handed us the key. Another guest who was also checking in, was being told about all of the wonderful amenities available. He was told of the weight room, yoga classes, a reciprocal agreement with the Westin next door, etc... When I asked the clerk to tell me a little about the Ali'i, she said that since I booked through Maui Beachfront Rentals, her only obligation was to give me a key. Shocked at her rudeness, I questioned her further. She said that 12 of the condos are maintained separately and I had one of them, which meant no weight room, no yoga, no housekeeping, no privileges at the Westin, etc. It also meant that mine was quite out of date and that there was no full ocean view, as I had paid for. No big deal, but just be aware. She handed me a beautiful brochure and told me that next time I might rethink who I book through. Also, she told me that the water would be turned off the next day to renovate another condo, and that cable workers would be in and out of the condos Monday through Friday. The clerk walked away without telling us which building we were in and where to find it, and where to park. We were very kind and were shocked at the way we were treated. It is for this reason that we won't return to the Ali'i. The pool was also closed for at least 24 hours because someone had a big accident in it. We worked around all of these issues and had the most wonderful vacation in Maui and Kauai. The Ali'i was only 5 out of our 11 days in Hawaii. Just be careful when you book, that you do not have one of the 12 separately maintained condos. Kaanapali Beach is the perfect location for a family, but we will never stay at the Ali'i again.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we wanted”
Reviews.Author: thezits
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and our 2 college aged children stayed here this past January. We loved it! The view from the balcony was great. There is nothing like having breakfast and lunch with a great view to boot. There was renovation going on, but the only disruption we had was waiting for an elevator. Yes, the pool is very small, but we were always able to find a lounger if we wanted it . There were also beach chairs available and quite honestly with that great big Pacific Ocean out there who cares about the pool. The location was great. Easy walk to Whaler's Village. Reasonably good restaurants there. We enjoyed Leilani's(get the purple sweet potatoes). We did book a premier oceanview room. The room was one of the nicest we ever stayed in and we travel extensively domestically. I am also one to complain very easily if there is a problem, but there were no surprizes here. Just lots of relaxation.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent condo/beach/location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were in a top floor ocean view room - the condo, beach and location were excellent. However, the pool facilities left much to be desired. I would recommend this place to families who are not interested in pool facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: work_for_travelling
Reviews.Content: There was 11 of us in our party, so we had two rooms, a garden view and an ocean view. Both rooms were beautiful! The hotel is in an amazing location on the Kaanapali Beach, I think on the best part of the beach actually. The waves were great and the water was beautiful. Outside there were BBQ's where we BBQ'd fish and steak. They were clean and we never had to wait to use them. It was all so convenient and comfortable and clean. I would give this place a 10 out of 10 for everything, I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Could it get better?”
Reviews.Author: Mckenna88
Reviews.Content: Our family just returned from a 5 night 6 day stay in Maui where we stayed at the beautiful Kaanapali Alii condos. What a treat. We are a family of 4 with 2 children ages 9 and 11. The Alii gave us space and comfort and our view from our 1 bedroom 2 bath accommodations gave us front row seats for the most gorgeous sunsets. The condo offers maid service every day, which includes making the beds, new towels, vacuuming, dishes, and optional turn down service. The condo is large, large enough we could have easily shared it with another couple and 2 small children. The complex offers an average size pool (no slides or beverage service) but new and beautiful barbeques for everyone to use. The ocean is at your door and the beach there is #1. The staff was very helpful. And did I mention top notch tennis courts with lights. As I sit here and write this I am half tempted to see if they are booked for an October just Mom and Dad trip. I would highly recommend this complex if you are a family and would like to save a few bucks by having the option to have a full kitchen that enables you to have breakfast and/or lunch in your room. Which is pretty easy since there is a grocery store just a short car ride away and worth the trip just to have a wonderful table at sunset - just you and your family with wine and or kid drinks with umbrellas. Aloha!!

Reviews.Title: “Kaanapali Alii - Excellent Condo, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was my 2nd stay at the Kaanapali Alii in 2 years. I used Royal Hawaii to book and was not disappointed. The 1st trip in April of 2004, I booked a 'premier' condo. This means it was recently updated with tile, subzero fridge, updated kitchen and bathrooms. Unit 372 was very nice. This most recent trip in July 2005, I did not reserve a 'premier' and was concerned. However, when I arrived, condo #3112 was also very nice. While not as updated as the premier, it still met all of our needs, was clean and had a beautiful ocean view on the 11th floor. The owners of both units have taken very good care of their property. Since the units are 1500-1900sq ft, they may be too large for a single or couple who don't need or want that space or a kitchen. However, if they want quiet, the Alii is very quiet. I have never heard people in other units. Unlike a hotel with paper thin floors and walls. The employees at Kaanapali Alii were helpful and friendly. No complaints here. They even have security people near the beach to ensure the safety of resort guests. Location, location....the Kaanapali Alii is on the beach, has a pool, exercise room and gas bbq's. The Alii is just a short walk to the major hotels such as the Westin and Marriott. Thus, fine dining, nightclubs and shopping is within walking distance. Two resort golf courses are within walking distance and the lovely town of Lahaina is a short 5 min drive down the road. I give the Alii 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Best choice For a condo rental on Maui”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our fourth annual trip to Maui. The Alii is a perfect choice for a family that wants to have nice seclusion and privacy, but still be close to all the action.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good value”
Reviews.Author: jhwest
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel four times in the last seven years. My husband's family has been coming here almost yearly since the 70's. (I think they keep coming here for old time's sake). The pros of this hotel are: -The location (right in the middle of everything in Kaanapali. Five minute walk from Whaler Village) -The beach is pretty uncrowded compared to the big resorts nearby, and it's nice clean sand. -Very roomy condos. Nice sized kitchens and bedrooms. We have four small children and need all the space we can get. (We have stayed in a 2 BR each time) -Very clean and everything in good working condition. -Fully equipped kitchens are great. (one year we even made a full Thanksgiving dinner in ours!) Though you won't save as much money as you'd expect since groceries are so expensive. $8 for a box of Fruit Loops at the Lahaina Safeway! We brought boxes of cereal and baby formula in our suitcases last time to save $. -Having a washer/dryer is a dream. Also means less clothes to bring on your trip. (Leaves more room for groceries! LOL!) The cons: -The rooms need serious updating. They claim that most rooms have been recently renovated, but I've never managed to stay in one. On our last trip our family had three condos in different towers and they all looked like something out of a "Three's Company" episode. -The pool is nice but nothing great. Compared to all the fancy pools at the nearby hotels, my kids were kind of let down. There is a nice little kiddie pool for the very youngest guests. Small pool area also means the "5 a.m. beach chair scramble". Not enough chairs to go around! -No restaurants on site. Either you have to cook in your room or walk somewhere else to eat. Kind of a drag when you're in the pool and just want a quick bite. The Marriott next door delivers, but it takes forever. -Nothing fancy about this place. No artwork, no gorgeous landscaping, not even a real lobby! Call me petty, but when I pay this much money I want something special! Especially when the nearby hotels are so fantastic. If the condos were cheaper it would be worth it , but for this price they don't seem like a good value. The Alii is not gross or run down, just nothing great. If you have your heart set on staying in Kaanapali (though most of our friends stay in Kihei and really like it.) and want the space and convenience of a condo, you can try the Kaanapali Alii. There are lots of comments from people who've stayed in nice units, so you may want to try requesting one of those, if you can find out the #. Unless my in-laws are paying, I won't be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay for Families”
Reviews.Author: like2travel006
Reviews.Content: We rented 2 garden view condos next to each and one was definitely better than the other (decoration wise). Since there were two families staying for the week, the kitchen and home ammenities was a definite plus. Everyone from the front desk to the bellman to the activities director was more than helpful. Our cleaning lady was great and came on a daily basis. We would definitely come back but hope that when we do, all the units will have been remodeled.

Reviews.Title: “Could not have asked for more”
Reviews.Author: boxelle01
Reviews.Content: View from 10th floor condo was outstanding. Roomy, clean, with friendly staff. Lots of nearby activities, I can highly recommend this condo. I would recommend getting a unit form the 6th floor up for the best views, large palm trees may otherwise block view. Great beach, free chairs. If your looking for full service accomodations look elsewhere, you won't have someone coming by every 10 minutes offering drinks on the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Feels like a luxurious home in the tropics!”
Reviews.Author: Curly13
Reviews.Content: I have been to Hawaii about 18 times (I am not exaggerating). We stayed at the Alii 80% of the time (sometimes for two weeks at a time) and it is our favorite place. The rooms are gorgeous and spacious, the staff is helpful and friendly, the pool calm and quiet - and you can't beat the location as it is near the heart of Lahaina with its amazing restaurants and shops. Hawaii in general is very pricey, but it is great to stock up the condo with food and save some money each day. It is incredible to eat breakfast each day on the balcony and come in for lunch after a tiring morning of swimming, snorkeling and lying in the sun and not have to wait for food to be served to you at a restaurant. Then, we could splurge on a nice dinner at night. This place is great for families and there is plenty of room. The rooms are pricey here, but if you have children, you are saving money in the long run -- one condo, plus eating certain meals in is less than buying two hotel rooms and eating out every meal. This place has luxurious units, but it feels like a home. It never gets too crowded and it creates a very easy vacation. It does not have a hotel feel at all -the pool doesn't have waterfalls and slides like the other hotel resorts and you won't see swans on top of koi ponds. But, if you want beautiful condo accommodations in a nice area - this is your place.

Reviews.Title: “Best Condos on Kaanapali Beach”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from our 5th stay at the Alii; 4 of those visits we stayed in the same 2-bedroom unit. Our unit is privately owned (from what our rental agent tells, he/she owns 6 units in the Alii) and is beautifully decorated. I do believe that we have been lucky because our rental agent is very particular and requires the owner(s) to update/replace furnishings before they take it on as a rental. FYI: The rental agent is Maui Beachfront Rentals ----------- . I am most sure that Classic Resorts (who manage the Alii) also manages/rents a good number of units in the Alii; that is, could be those of which are less desirable. It boggles my mind that people owning condos costing 1 to 3 million dollars would let them fall apart, but.... Nonetheless, we have been spoiled by our wonderful stays at the Alii and plan to vacation there next year--in the same unit. You couldn't ask for a better location. Has anyone stayed at the Marriott since it changed to a time-share?

Reviews.Title: “First Class Stay”
Reviews.Author: hummingbird
Reviews.Content: My family and I just spent 8 wonderful days at the Kaanapali Alii. We could not of asked for a better place to stay. We had an ocean front - premier room - expensive, but worth every penny! Our unit was well decorated, spotless and huge. The staff are extremely helpful with everything from bringing in the groceries to booking tours. The grounds of the condos were kept immaculate and very pleasing to the eye. Although the pool area is small, the pool and the area around it were kept very neat and clean and the fresh lemonade was a nice touch. Condos are situated right in the middle of Kaanapali beach which makes it handy to get around. We will definately stay at this property again!
